quote: Happiness is having a large  loving  caring  close-knit family ... in another city.
author: George Burns

quote: Human beings are the only creatures on Earth that allow children to come back home.
author: Bill Cosby

quote: Children have become so expensive that only the poor can afford them.
author: Anonymous

quote: Never brag about your ancestors coming over on the Mayflower  the immigration laws weren't as strict in those days.
author: Lew Lehr

quote: Whenever I'm with my [teenager]  I feel as though I have to spend the whole time avoiding land mines.
author: Amy Tan

quote: They are doing away with drive-ins. Now where are the teenagers going to go to not watch a movie?
author: Bob Thomas

quote: Big sisters are the crabgrass in the lawn of life.
author: Charles Schulz

quote: My son has taken up meditation - at least it's better than sitting doing nothing.
author: Max Kaufman

quote: A scout is a boy who dresses like a schmuck. A scoutmaster is a schmuck who dresses like a boy.
author: Anonymous

quote: It appears there's a little too much chlorine in their gene pool.
author: Anonymous

quote: In America there are two classes of travel -  first class and with children.
author: Robert Benchley

quote: The best thing to do is to behave in a manner befitting one's age. If you are sixteen and under  try not to go bald.
author: Woody Allen

quote: I think a dysfunctional family is any family with more than one person in it.
author: Mary Karr

quote: Family is just accident. . . . They don't mean to get on your nerves. They don't even mean to be your family  they just are.
author: Marsha Norman

quote: My father told me marijuana would cause me brain damage - because if he caught me doing it he was going to break my head.
author: Tom Dreesen

quote: We're supposed to take our problems to a family adviser. Personally  I've never met a family adviser. They're all off somewhere listening to dirty stories.
author: Robert Orben

quote: The reason grandparents and grandchildren get along so well is that they have a common enemy.
author: Sam Levenson

quote: Have children while your parents are still young enough to take care of them.
author: Rita Rudner

quote: Let's face it  there's lots of spoiled kids out there . . . because you can't spank Grandma.
author: Janet Anderson

quote: Family life got better and we got our car back -  as soon as we put "I love Mom" on the license plate.
author: Erma Bombeck

quote: You know your children are growing up when they stop asking where they came from and refuse to tell you where they're going.
author: P. O'Brien

quote: I hate housework! You make the beds  you do the dishes - and six months later you have to start all over again.
author: Joan Rivers

quote: I don't want to say anything about my kids . . . but I go to PTA meetings under an assumed name!
author: Robert Orben

quote: The Jewish man with parents still alive is a fifteen-year-old boy and will remain a fifteen-year-old boy until they die.
author: Philip Roth

quote: Few mistakes can be made by a mother-in-law who is willing to baby-sit.
author: Anonymous

quote: Adolescence is when children start trying to bring up their parents.
author: Richard Armour

quote: Adults are just children who earn money.
author: Kenneth Branagh

quote: I read one psychologist's theory that said  "Never strike a child in your anger." When could I strike him? When he is kissing me on my birthday? When he's recuperating from measles? Do I slap the Bible out of his hand on Sunday?
author: Erma Bombeck

quote: It takes about five years for a walnut tree to produce nuts  but this is not true of a family tree.
author: Anonymous

quote: My father never raised his hand to any one of his children - except in self-defense.
author: Fred Allen

quote: To encourage my little kid to eat I'd sometimes say: "Just pretend it's sand."
author: Anonymous

quote: Ask your child what he wants for dinner only if he's buying.
author: Fran Lebowitz

quote: Sis  I've been wondering . . . On my birthday mom always gives me five thousand dollars. How much does she give you?
author: Anonymous

quote: My kid asked if he could borrow ten dollars. When I only gave him five dollars he said  "Okay  since you owe me the other five dollars  we'll call it even."
author: Anonymous

quote: Never raise your hands to your kids. It leaves your groin unprotected.
author: Red Buttons

quote: Never lend your car to someone you've given birth to.
author: Erma Bombeck

quote: We were so poor we had no hot water. But it didn't matter because we had no bathtub to put it in anyway.
author: Tom Dreesen

quote: In most states you can get a driver's license when you're sixteen years old  which made a lot of sense to me when I was sixteen years old but now seems insane.
author: Phyllis Diller

quote: Home is the place  when you have to go there  they have to take you in.
author: Robert Frost

quote: I love being a great-grandparent  but what I hate is being the the mother of a grandparent.
author: Janet Anderson

quote: I want you to know how I feel about my Italian heritage  so I'd like to say a few words in Italian: Verdi  Pavarotti  DiMaggio  Valentino  De Niro  Giuliani. . .
author: Susan Lucci

quote: A child prodigy is one with highly imaginative parents.
author: Anonymous

quote: I've just been to a debutant ball where all the girls were wearing low-cut gowns. It's clear why they're called coming out parties.
author: Martin Fenton

quote: When I reprimanded my son for hair like Michael Jackson  he said: "I don't see the problem you wear yours like Michael Jordan."
author: Anonymous

quote: Watching your daughter being collected by her date feels like handing over a million-dollar Stradivarius to a gorilla.
author: Jim Bishop

quote: Insanity runs in my family. It practically gallops.
author: Gary Grant

quote: Keep in mind ... to a dog you are family  to a cat you are staff.
author: Anonymous

quote: The happiest moments of my life have been the few which I have passed at home in the bosom of my family.
author: Thomas Jefferson

quote: There is little less trouble in governing a private family than a whole kingdom.
author: Michel Montaigne

quote: None but a mule denies his family.
author: Moroccan proverb

quote: Fare thee well! and if for ever  Still for ever  fare thee well.
author: Lord Byron

quote: Sweets to the sweet  farewell!
author: William Shakespeare

quote: A farmer is always going to be rich next year.
author: Philemon

quote: Farming is a most senseless pursuit  a mere laboring in a circle. You sow that you may reap  and then you reap that you may sow. Nothing ever comes of it.
author: Joannes Stobaeus

quote: Some people tell us that there ain't no Hell  But they never farmed  so how can they tell?
author: Anonymous

quote: Those who labor in the earth are the chosen people of God  if He ever had a chosen people  whose breasts He has made His peculiar deposit for substantial and genuine virtue.
author: Thomas Jefferson

quote: The farmer works the soil  The agriculturist works the farmer.
author: Eugene F. Ware

quote: Let us never forget that the cultivation of the earth is the most important labor of man. When tillage begins  other arts follow. The farmers  therefore  are the founders of civilization.
author: Daniel Webster

quote: A love of fashion makes the economy go round.
author: Liz Tilberis

quote: A pious man is one who would be an atheist if the king were.
author: Jean de la Bruyere

quote: Every generation laughs at the old fashions but religiously follows the new.
author: Henry David Thoreau

quote: Nothing is so hideous as an obsolete fashion.
author: Stendhal

quote: "The tradition of the new." Yesterday's avant-gard-experiment is today's chic and tomorrow's cliche.
author: Richard Hofstadter

quote: Art produces ugly things which frequently become beautiful with time. Fashion  on the other hand  produces beautiful things which always become ugly with time.
author: Jean Cocteau

quote: Be not the first by whom the new are tried  Nor yet the last to lay the old aside.
author: Alexander Pope

quote: Fashion can be bought. Style one must possess.
author: Edna Woolman Chase

quote: Fashion  which elevates the bad to the level of the good  subsequently turns its back on bad and good alike.
author: Eric Bentley

quote: Even knowledge has to be in fashion and where it is not it is wise to affect ignorance.
author: Baltasar Gracian

quote: The fashion wears out more apparel than the man.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: Fashions  after all  are only induced epidemics.
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: When a man is once in fashion  all he does is right.
author: Lord Chesterfield

quote: I have heard with admiring submission the experience of the lady who declared that the sense of being well-dressed gives a feeling of inward tranquility  which religion is powerless to bestow.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: Fashion condemns us to many follies  the greatest is to make oneself its slave.
author: Napoleon Bonaparte

quote: Conformism is so hot on the heels of the mass-produced avant-garde that the 'ins' and the 'outs' change places with the speed of mach 3.
author: Igor Stravinsky

quote: There goes a man made by the Lord Almighty and not by his tailor.
author: Andrew Jackson

quote: Fashions fade - style is eternal.
author: Yves Saint Laurent

quote: And by my grave you'd pray to have me back So I could see how well you look in black.
author: Marco Carson

quote: A man of eighty has outlived probably three new schools of painting  two of architecture and poetry  and a hundred in dress.
author: Joyce Carey

quote: A fashionable woman is always in love - with herself.
author: La Rochefoucauld

quote: I see that the fashion wears out more apparel than the man.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: Fashion is a form of ugliness so intolerable that we have to alter it every six months.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: Certainty generally is illusion and repose is not the destiny of man.
author: Oliver Wendell Holmes

quote: How many roads must a man walk down Before you call him a man?
author: Bob Dylan

quote: Heaven is the place where the donkey finally catches up with his carrot: hell is the eternity while he waits for it.
author: Russell Green

quote: Continuous effort - not strength or intelligence - is the key to unlocking our potential.
author: Liane Cardes

quote: That that is is.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: Everything passes  everything wears out  everything breaks.(Tout passe  tout lasse  tout casse.)
author: French proverb

quote: Whatso'er we perpetrate We do but row  we are steered by fate.
author: Samuel Butler

quote: Whatever limits us we call Fate.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: Whatever the universal nature assigns to any man at any time is for the good of that man at that time.
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: Certain signs precede certain events.
author: Cicero

quote: See how the Fates their gifts allot. For A is happy - B is not. Yet B is worthy  I dare say  Of more prosperity than A.
author: W. S. Gilbert

quote: Destiny  n: a tyrant's authority for crime and a fool's excuse for failure.
author: Ambrose Bierce

quote: Fate rules the affairs of mankind with no recognizable order.
author: Seneca

quote: He who does not desire or fear the uncertain day or capricious fate  is equal to the gods above and loftier than mortals.
author: Justus Lipsius

quote: The worst is not always certain but it's very likely.
author: French proverb

quote: It is a long road from conception to completion.
author: Moliere

quote: God keeps the wicked to give them time to repent.
author: Sophie Rostopchine Sigur

quote: Fortune is fickle and soon asks back what he has given.
author: Latin proverb

quote: Destiny is what you are supposed to do in life. Fate is what kicks you in the ass to make you do it.
author: Henry Miller

quote: That which God writes on thy forehead  thou wilt come to it.
author: The Koran

quote: When its time has come  the prey goes to the hunter.
author: Persian proverb

quote: The bow is bent  the arrow flies  The winged shaft of fate.
author: Ira Aldridge

quote: He has gone to the demnition bow-wows.
author: Charles Dickens

quote: 'Tis Fate that flings the dice  And as she flings Of kings makes peasants  And of peasants kings.
author: Anonymous

quote: Thou must (in commanding and winning  or serving and losing  suffering or triumphing) be either anvil or hammer.
author: Goethe

quote: We make our fortunes and we call them fate.
author: Benjamin Disraeli

quote: Though men determine  the gods do dispose: and oft times many things fall out between the cup and the lip.
author: Robert Greene

quote: The Moving Finger writes  and having writ  Moves on  nor all your Piety nor Wit Shall lure it back to cancel half a Line  Nor all your Tears wash out a Word of it.
author: Omar Khayyam

quote: The die is cast.
author: Suetonius

quote: The fathers have eaten sour grapes  and the children's teeth are set on edge.
author: Bible

quote: Call no man your father upon the earth: for one is your Father  which is in heaven.
author: Matthew

quote: It is a wise father that knows his own child.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: A father is a banker provided by nature.
author: French proverb

quote: The child is father of the man.
author: William Wordsworth

quote: There is so much good in the worst of us  And so much bad in the best of us  That it ill behooves any of us To find fault with the rest of us.
author: Anonymous

quote: The greatest of faults  I should say  is to be conscious of none.
author: Thomas Carlyle

quote: The defects of great men are the consolation of the dunces.
author: Isaac D'Israeli

quote: We keep on deceiving ourselves in regard to our faults  until we at last come to look upon them as virtues.
author: Heinrich Heine

quote: A fanatic is a man who consciously over-compensates a secret doubt.
author: Aldous Huxley

quote: Fear is the parent of cruelty.
author: James A. Froude

quote: We must travel in the direction of our fear.
author: John Berryman

quote: Once men are caught up in an event they cease to be afraid. Only the unknown frightens men.
author: Antoine de St. Exupery

quote: People wish to learn to swim and at the same time to keep one foot on the ground.
author: Marcel Proust

quote: Fear is not an unknown emotion to us.
author: Neil Armstrong

quote: So let me assert my firm belief that the only thing we have to fear is fear itself - nameless  unreasoning  unjustified terror which paralyzes needed efforts to convert retreat into advance.
author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

quote: I will show you fear in a handful of dust.
author: T. S. Eliot

quote: Fear of losing is what makes competitors so great. Show me a gracious loser and I'll show you a perennial loser.
author: O. J. Simpson

quote: Nothing in life is to be feared. It is only to be understood.
author: Marie Curie

quote: Nothing is more despicable than respect based on fear.
author: Albert Camus

quote: Just as courage imperils life  fear protects it.
author: Leonardo da Vinci

quote: Fear comes from uncertainty. When we are absolutely certain  whether of our worth or worthlessness  we are almost impervious to fear. Thus a feeling of utter unworthiness can be a source of courage.
author: Eric Hoffer

quote: Where no hope is left  is left no fear.
author: John Milton

quote: The human race is a race of cowards  and I am not only marching in that procession but carrying a banner.
author: Mark Twain

quote: Men hesitate less to injure a man who makes himself loved than to injure one who makes himself feared  for their love is held by a chain of obligation which  because of men's wickedness  is broken on every occasion for the sake of selfish profit  but their fear is secured by a dread of punishment.
author: Niccolo Machiavelli

quote: I  a stranger and afraid In a world I never made.
author: A. E. Housman

quote: Fear has a smell  as Love does.
author: Margaret Atwood

quote: Fear can be headier than whisky  once man has acquired a taste for it.
author: Donald Dowries

quote: The suspense is terrible. I hope it will last.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: A good scare is worth more to a man than good advice.
author: Edgar Watson Howe

quote: How does one kill fear  I wonder? How do you shoot a spectre through the heart  slash off its spectral head  take it by the spectral throat?
author: Joseph Conrad

quote: In grief we know the worst of what we feel  But who can tell the end of what we fear?
author: Hannah More

quote: The only way to get rid of my fears is to make films about them.
author: Alfred Hitchcock

quote: I would often be a coward  but for the shame of it.
author: Ralph Connor

quote: Horror is a feeling that cannot last long  human nature is incapable of supporting it.
author: James de Mille

quote: The horse does abominate the camel  the mighty elephant is afraid of a mouse  and they say that the lion  which scorneth to turn his back upon the stoutest animal  will tremble at the crowing of a cock.
author: Increase Mather

quote: The flocks fear the wolf  the crops the storm  and the trees the wind.
author: Virgil

quote: We all choke  and the man who says he doesn't choke is lying like hell.
author: Lee Trevino

quote: A man who says he has never been scared is either lying or else he's never been any place or done anything.
author: Louis L'Amour

quote: All men are afraid in battle. The coward is the one who lets his fear overcome his sense of duty. Duty is the essence of manhood.
author: General George S. Patton

quote: Only the self-deceived will claim perfect freedom from fear.
author: Bill W.

quote: Every day I wake up a little afraid. Only a fool is never afraid.
author: Ron Meyer

quote: This is the century of fear.
author: Albert Camus

quote: There is perhaps nothing so bad and so dangerous in life as fear.
author: Jawaharlal Nehru

quote: The trouble with most people is that they think with their hopes or fears or wishes rather than with their minds.
author: Nancy Astor

quote: Fear  true fear  is a savage frenzy. Of all the insanities of which we are capable  it is surely the most cruel.
author: Georges Bernanos

quote: Fear is the fire that melts Icarian wings.
author: Florence Earle Coates

quote: There seemed to be endless obstacles-it seemed that the root cause of them all was fear.
author: Joanna Field

quote: How very little can be done under the spirit of fear.
author: Florence Nightingale

quote: The most destructive element in the human mind is fear. Fear creates aggressiveness  aggressiveness engenders hostility  hostility engenders fear-a disastrous circle.
author: Dorothy Thompson

quote: A man's doubts and fears are his worst enemies.
author: William Wrigley

quote: Great self-destruction follows upon unfounded fear.
author: Ursula K. LeGuin

quote: Fear is the most devastating of all human emotions. Man has no trouble like the paralyzing effects of fear.
author: Paul Parker

quote: Only when we are no longer afraid do we begin to live.
author: Dorothy Thompson

quote: Neither a man nor a crowd nor a nation can be trusted to act humanely or to think sanely under the influence of a great fear.
author: Bertrand Russell

quote: The worst sorrows in life are not in its losses and misfortunes  but its fears.
author: Arthur Christopher Benson

quote: No passion so effectually robs the mind of all its powers of acting and reasoning as fear.
author: Edmund Burke

quote: The thing I fear most is fear.
author: Michel de Montaigne

quote: Nothing is so much to be feared as fear.
author: Henry David Thoreau

quote: Nothing is terrible except fear itself.
author: Francis Bacon

quote: The only thing we have to fear is fear itself-nameless  unreasoning  unjustified terror which paralyzes needed efforts to convert retreat into advance.
author: Franklin Delano Roosevelt

quote: It is better by noble boldness to run the risk of being subject to half the evils we anticipate than to remain in cowardly listlessness for fear of what might happen.
author: Herodotus

quote: There is no devil but fear.
author: Elbert Hubbard

quote: Men who look young  act young  and everlastingly harp on the fact that they are young-but who nevertheless think and act with a degree of caution what would be excessive in their grandfathers-are the curses of the world.
author: Robertson Davies

quote: There's nothing I'm afraid of like scared people.
author: Robert Frost

quote: God! Is there anything uglier than a frightened man!
author: Jean Anouilh

quote: The only thing I am afraid of is fear.
author: Arthur Wellesley

quote: Of all the passions  fear weakens judgment most.
author: Cardinal de Retz

quote: All forms of fear produce fatigue.
author: Bertrand Russell

quote: The more I traveled the more I realized that fear makes strangers of people who should be friends.
author: Shirley MacLaine

quote: Power does not corrupt. Fear corrupts  perhaps the fear of a loss of power.
author: John Steinbeck

quote: When men are ruled by fear  they strive to prevent the very changes that will abate it.
author: Alan Paton

quote: Fear  if allowed free rein  would reduce all of us to trembling shadows of men  for whom only death could bring release.
author: John M. Wilson

quote: If we let things terrify us  life will not be worth living.
author: Marcus Annaeus Seneca

quote: When fear is excessive it can make many a man despair.
author: Saint Thomas Aquinas

quote: Fear makes the wolf bigger than he is.
author: German proverb

quote: One of the effects of fear is to disturb the senses and cause things to appear other than what they are.
author: Miguel de Cervantes

quote: What begins in fear usually ends in folly.
author: Samuel Taylor Coleridge

quote: In doubt  fear is the worst of prophets.
author: Statius

quote: Fear is the most damnable  damaging thing to human personality in the whole world.
author: William Faulkner

quote: Fear is the main source of superstition  and one of the main sources of cruelty.
author: Bertrand Russell

quote: Fear is like fire. If controlled it will help you  if uncontrolled  it will rise up and destroy you. Men's actions depend to a great extent upon fear. We do things either because we enjoy doing them or because we are afraid not to do them.
author: John F. Milburn

quote: To hate and to fear is to be psychologically ill... it is  in fact  the consuming illness of our time.
author: Harry A. Overstreet

quote: Fear is an acid which is pumped into one's atmosphere. It causes mental  moral and spiritual asphyxiation  and sometimes death  death to energy and all growth.
author: Horace Fletcher

quote: Fear is the proof of a degenerate mind.
author: Virgil

quote: Fear is an insidious virus. Given a breeding place in our minds ... it will eat away our spirit and block the forward path of our endeavors.
author: James F. Bell

quote: A man who is afraid will do anything.
author: Jawaharlal Nehru

quote: Excessive fear is always powerless.
author: Aeschylus

quote: Fear makes strangers of people who should be friends.
author: Shirley MacLaine

quote: O  how vain and vile a passion is this fear! What base  uncomely things it makes men do.
author: Samuel Johnson

quote: The unknown is what it is. And to be frightened of it is what sends everybody scurrying around chasing dreams  illusions  wars  peace  love  hate  all that. Unknown is what it is. Accept that it's unknown  and it's plain sailing.
author: John Lennon

quote: No passion so effectively robs the mind of its powers of acting and reasoning as fear.
author: Edmund Burke

quote: As many people die from an excess of timidity as from bravery.
author: Norman Mailer

quote: If a man harbors any sort of fear  it percolates through all his thinking  damages his personality  makes him landlord to a ghost.
author: Lloyd C. Douglas

quote: If you let fear of consequence prevent you from following your deepest instinct  then your life will be safe  expedient and thin.
author: Katharine Butler Hathaway

quote: There is nothing that fear or hope does not make men believe.
author: Vauvenargues

quote: Fear is the prison of the heart.
author: Anonymous

quote: I have come to realize that all my trouble with living has come from fear and smallness within me.
author: Angela L. Wozniak

quote: He who fears something gives it power over him.
author: Moorish proverb

quote: How very little can be done under the spirit of fear.
author: Florence Nightingale

quote: All fear is bondage.
author: Anonymous

quote: We promise according to our hopes  and perform according to our fears.
author: Francois de La Rochefoucauld

quote: There seemed to be endless obstacles ... it seemed that the root cause of them all was fear.
author: Joanna Field

quote: No power is strong enough to be lasting if it labors under the weight of fear.
author: Cicero

quote: Where fear is  happiness is not.
author: Marcus Annaeus Seneca

quote: Many fears are born of fatigue and loneliness.
author: Max Ehrmann

quote: We're frightened of what makes us different.
author: Anne Rice

quote: Fear always springs from ignorance.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: We are always afraid to start something that we want to make very good  true  and serious.
author: Brenda Ueland

quote: The craven's fear is but selfishness  like his merriment.
author: John Greenleaf Whittier

quote: When did reason ever direct our desires or our fears?
author: Juvenal

quote: Fear is created not by the world around us  but in the mind  by what we think is going to happen.
author: Elizabeth Gawain

quote: Fear is secured by a dread of punishment.
author: Niccolo Machiavelli

quote: We are largely the playthings of our fears. To one  fear of the dark  to another  of physical pain  to a third  of public ridicule  to a fourth  of poverty  to a fifth  of loneliness ... for all of us  our particular creature waits in ambush.
author: Horace Walpole

quote: If your desires be endless  your cares and fears will be so  too.
author: Thomas Fuller

quote: We fear the thing we want the most.
author: Dr. Robert Anthony

quote: We are more often frightened than hurt  and we suffer more from imagination than from reality.
author: Marcus Annaeus Seneca

quote: Fear  born of that stern matron  Responsibility.
author: William McFee

quote: Only your mind can produce fear.
author: Anonymous

quote: Fear follows crime  and is its punishment.
author: Voltaire

quote: All infractions of love and equity in our social relations are ... punished by fear.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: The only thing we have to fear on this planet is man.
author: Carl Jung

quote: There is nothing in the universe that I fear  but that I shall not know all my duty or fail to do it.
author: Mary Lyon

quote: I can stand what I know. It's what I don't know that frightens me.
author: Frances Newton

quote: I am never afraid of what I know.
author: Anna Sewell

quote: Fear comes from uncertainty. When we are absolutely certain  whether of our worth or worthlessness  we are almost impervious to fear.
author: William Congreve

quote: Let us not fear the hidden. Or each other.
author: Muriel Rukeyser

quote: We all fear what we don't know-it's natural.
author: Leo Buscaglia

quote: Fear always springs from ignorance.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: The only thing we have to fear is fear itself.
author: F. D. Roosevelt

quote: The fear of the Lord is the beginning of knowledge.
author: Bible

quote: Why should we break up Our snug and pleasant party? Time was made for slaves  But never for us so hearty.
author: John B. Buckstone

quote: Let us have wine and woman  mirth and laughter. Sermons and soda-water the day after.
author: Lord Byron

quote: The feast of reason  and the flow of soul.
author: Alexander Pope

quote: Feast  and your halls are crowded  Fast  and the world goes by.
author: Ella Wheeler Wilc

quote: Your own property is concerned when your neighbor's house is on fire.
author: Horace

quote: The burnt child dreads the fire.
author: Ben Jonson

quote: There can no great smoke arise  but there must be some fire.
author: John Lyly

quote: AH the fat's in the fire.
author: John Marston

quote: As lacking in privacy as a goldfish.
author: Anonymous

quote: She is neither fish  nor flesh  nor good red herring.
author: John Heywood

quote: Master  I marvel how the fishes live in the sea. Why  as men do a-land: the great ones eat up the little ones.
author: Pericles

quote: We have here other fish to fry.
author: Francois Rabelais

quote: There are as good fish in the sea as ever came out of it.
author: English proverb

quote: To fish in troubled waters.
author: Matthew Henry

quote: You must lose a fly to catch a trout.
author: George Edward Herbert

quote: A fishing-rod was a stick with a hook at one end and a fool at the other.
author: Samuel Johnson

quote: Angling may be said to be so like the mathematics that it can never be fully learnt.
author: Izaak Walton

quote: God never did make a more calm  quiet  innocent recreation than angling.
author: Izaak Walton

quote: Angling is an innocent cruelty.
author: George Parker

quote: If any one attempts to haul down the American flag  shoot him on the spot.
author: John A. Dix

quote: When Freedom from her mountain height Unfurled her standard to the air  She tore the azure robe of night  And set the stars of glory there.
author: Joseph Rodman Drake

quote: Cheers for the sailors that fought on the wave for it  Cheers for the soldiers that always were brave for it  Tears for the men that went down to the grave for it  Here comes the Flag!
author: Arthur Macy

quote: The flag of our Union forever!
author: George P. Morris

quote: Oh! say  does that star-spangled banner yet wave  O'er the land of the free and the home of the brave.
author: Francis Scott Key

quote: Yes  we'll rally round the flag  boys  we'll rally once again  Shouting the battle-cry of Freedom  We will rally from the hillside  we'll gather from the plain  Shouting the battle-cry of Freedom.
author: George F. Root

quote: Your flag and my flag  And how it flies today In your land and my land And half a world away! Rose-red and blood-reed The stripes forever gleam  Snow-white and soul-white -  The good forefathers' dream  Sky-blue and true-blue  with stars to gleam aright -  The gloried guidon of the day  a shelter through the night.
author: Wilbur D. Nesbit

quote: "Shoot  if you must  this old gray head  But spare your country's flag " she said.
author: John Greenleaf Whittier

quote: Imitation is the sincerest (form) of flattery.
author: Walter Colton

quote: Men are like stone jugs - you may lug them where you like by the ears.
author: Samuel Johnson

quote: A man that flattereth his neighbor spreadeth a net for his feet.
author: Bible

quote: O  that men's ears should be To counsel deaf  but not to flattery!
author: William Shakespeare

quote: Their throat is an open sepulchre  they flatter with their tongue.
author: Bible

quote: It is easy to flatter  it is harder to praise.
author: Jean Paul Richter

quote: Flirtation  attention without intention.
author: Max O'Neil

quote: Men seldom make passes At girls who wear glasses.
author: Dorothy Parker

quote: It is the same in love as in war  a fortress that parleys is half taken.
author: Marguerite de Valois

quote: Flowers may beckon towards us  but they speak toward heaven and God.
author: Henry Ward Beecher

quote: Flowers are words Which even a babe may understand.
author: Bishop Coxe

quote: But ne'er the rose without the thorn.
author: Robert Herrick

quote: And I will make thee beds of roses  And a thousand fragrant posies.
author: Christopher Marlowe

quote: Consider the lilies of the field  how they grow  they toil not  neither do they spin.
author: Matthew

quote: Flowers of all hue  and without thorn the rose.
author: John Milton

quote: In Flanders' fields the poppies blow Between the crosses  row on row  That mark our place  and in the sky  The larks  still bravely singing  fly Scarce heard among the guns below.
author: John McCrae

quote: Tis the last rose of summer. Left blooming alone.
author: George Moore

quote: Where flowers degenerate man cannot live.
author: Napoleon

quote: "Of what are you afraid  my child?" inquired the kindly teacher. "Oh  sir! the flowers  they are wild " replied the timid creature.
author: Peter Newell

quote: If of thy mortal goods thoU art bereft  And from thy slender store two loaves alone to thee are left  Sell one  and with the dole Buy hyacinths to feed thy soul.
author: Sadi

quote: Say it with flowers.
author: Patrick F. O'Keefe

quote: I sometimes think that never blows so red The Rose as where some buried Caesar bled  That every Hyacinth the Garden wears Dropt in her Lap from some once lovely Head.
author: Omar Khayyam

quote: One thing is certain and the rest is lies  The Flower that once has blown for ever dies.
author: Omar Khayyam

quote: When lilacs last in the dooryard bloom'd  And the great star early droop'd in the western sky the night  I mourn'd - and yet shall mourn with ever-returning spring.
author: Walt Whitman

quote: It is easier to catch flies with honey than with vinegar.
author: English proverb

quote: A fly sat on the chariot wheel And said "What a dust I raise."
author: Jean de la Fontaine

quote: Baby bye Here's a fly  Let us watch him  you and I. How he crawls Up the walls Yet he never falls.
author: Theodore Tilton

quote: The folly of one man is the fortune of another.
author: Sir Francis Bacon

quote: He who lives without committing any folly is not so wise as he thinks.
author: La Rochefoucauld

quote: Answer a fool according to his folly.
author: Bible

quote: To swallow gudgeons ere they're catch'd And count their chickens ere they're hatch'd.
author: Nicholas Murray Butler

quote: To stumble twice against the same stone  is a proverbial disgrace.
author: Cicero

quote: At the end of every diet  the path curves back toward the trough.
author: Mason Cooley

quote: Food is an important part of a balanced diet.
author: Fran Lebowitz

quote: It's a very odd thing As odd as can be That whatever Miss T. eats Turns into Miss T.
author: Walter de la Mare

quote: Never eat more than you can lift.
author: Miss Piggy

quote: There is no love sincerer than the love of food.
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: Kissing don't last: cookery do.
author: George Meredith

quote: Hunger is not debatable.
author: Harry Hopkins

quote: To eat well in England you should have breakfast three times a day.
author: W. Somerset Maugham

quote: To get the best results  you must talk to your vegetables.
author: Charles, Prince of Wales

quote: Toots Shore's restaurant is so crowded nobody goes there anymore.
author: Yogi Berra

quote: Dinner  a time when . . . one should eat wisely but not too well  and talk well but not too wisely.
author: W. Somerset Maugham

quote: There is no such thing as a little garlic.
author: Anonymous

quote: Even were a cook to cook a fly  he would keep the breast for himself.
author: Polish proverb

quote: No man is lonely while eating spaghetti - it requires so much attention.
author: Christopher Morley

quote: A hungry man is not a free man.
author: Adlai Stevenson

quote: A great step toward independence is a good-humoured stomach.
author: Seneca

quote: I feel a recipe is only a theme  which an intelligent cook can play each time with a variation.
author: Madame Benoit

quote: All happiness depends on a leisurely breakfast.
author: John Gunther

quote: Cheese - milk's leap toward immortality.
author: Clifton Fadiman

quote: A gourmet is just a glutton with brains.
author: Philip W. Haberman

quote: Vegetarianism is harmless enough  though it is apt to fill a man with wind and self-righteousness.
author: Sir Robert Hutchinson

quote: If you wish to grow thinner  diminish your dinner.
author: H. S. Leigh

quote: To a man with an empty stomach  food is god.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

quote: Hunger is the best sauce.
author: Proverbs

quote: A man is in general better pleased when he has a good dinner upon his table  than when his wife talks Greek.
author: Samuel Johnson

quote: If you ask the hungry man how much is two and two  he replies four loaves.
author: Hindu proverb

quote: A good meal makes a man feel more charitable toward the whole world than any sermon.
author: Arthur Pendenys

quote: More die in the United States of too much food than of too little.
author: J. K. Galbraith

quote: A good meal ought to begin with hunger.
author: French proverb

quote: It is a hard matter  my fellow citizens  to argue with the belly  since it has no ears.
author: Plutarch

quote: The one way to get thin is to re-establish a purpose in life.
author: Cyril Connolly

quote: A smiling face is half the meal.
author: Latvian proverb

quote: There is no such thing as a pretty good omelette.
author: French proverb

quote: Fish  to taste right  must swim three times - in water  in butter and in wine.
author: Polish proverb

quote: A fool's head never whitens.
author: Old saying

quote: For ye suffer fools gladly  seeing ye yourselves are wise.
author: Bible

quote: Many have been the wise speeches of fools  though not so many as the foolish speeches of wise men.
author: Thomas Fuller

quote: Men trip not on mountains  they stumble on stones.
author: Old saying

quote: There are bearded fools.
author: Old saying

quote: Every man is a damn fool for at least five minutes every day  wisdom consists in not exceeding the limit.
author: Elbert Hubbard

quote: Nothing is more like a wise man than a fool who holds his tongue.
author: St. Francis de Sales

quote: If fifty million people say a foolish thing  it is still a foolish thing.
author: Anatole France

quote: There are two kinds of fools: one says  'This is old  therefore it is good'  the other says  'This is new  therefore it is better.'
author: Dean William R. Inge

quote: A fool must now and then be right by chance.
author: William Cowper

quote: Let us be thankful for the fools. But for them the rest of us could not succeed.
author: Mark Twain

quote: Here cometh April again  and as far as I can see the world hath more fools in it than ever.
author: Charles Lamb

quote: A busy fool is fitter to be shut up than a downright madman.
author: George, Lord Halifax

quote: With stupidity the gods themselves struggle in vain.
author: Friedrich von Schiller

quote: There are some people that if they don't know  you can't tell 'em.
author: Louis Armstrong

quote: A fellow who is always declaring he's no fool usually has his suspicions.
author: Wilson Mizner

quote: Stupidity is an elemental force for which no earthquake is a match.
author: Karl Kraus

quote: Every inch that is not fool is rogue.
author: John Dryden

quote: A little nonsense now and then is relished by the wisest men.
author: Anonymous

quote: He who lives without folly is not as wise as he thinks.
author: La Rochefoucauld

quote: The poor schlemiel is a man who falls on his back and breaks his nose.
author: Jewish proverb

quote: None but a fool worries about things he cannot influence.
author: Samuel Johnson

quote: Nature never makes any blunders  when she makes a fool she means it.
author: Josh Billings

quote: Set a beggar on horseback  and he will ride a gallop.
author: Robert Burton

quote: It is said that a wise man who stands firm is a statesman  and a foolish man who stands firm is a catastrophe.
author: Adlai Stevenson

quote: It is hard to free fools from the chains they revere.
author: Voltaire

quote: Hain't we got all the fools in town on our side? And ain't that a big enough majority for any town?
author: Mark Twain

quote: For God's sake give me the young man who has brains enough to make a fool of himself.
author: Robert Louis Stevenson

quote: Who loves not women  wine and song  Remains a fool his whole life long.
author: Martin Luther

quote: What is life but a series of inspired follies? The difficulty is to find them to do.
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: There is no chance for old fools.
author: Cree Indian proverb

quote: A fool always finds one still more foolish to admire him.
author: Nicolas Boileau

quote: You men think old men are fools  but old men know young men are the fools.
author: George Chapman

quote: Hain't we got all the fools in town on our side? And ain't that a big enough majority in any town?
author: S. L. Clemens

quote: A fool and his money are soon parted.
author: English proverb

quote: The fool hath said in his heart  There is no God.
author: Bible

quote: A learned fool is more foolish than an ignorant fool.
author: Moliere

quote: For fools rush in where angels fear to tread.
author: Alexander Pope

quote: Even a fool  when he holdeth his peace  is counted wise.
author: Bible

quote: The right to be a cussed fool Is safe from all devices human  It's common (ez a gin'I rule) To every critter born of woman.
author: James Russell Lowell

quote: It is in the half fools and the half wise that the greatest danger lies.
author: Goethe

quote: If you wish to avoid seeing a fool you must first break your looking-glass.
author: Francois Rabelais

quote: The fool doth think he is wise  but the wise man knows himself to be a fool.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: A fool's bolt is soon shot.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: Lord  what fools these mortals be!
author: William Shakespeare

quote: He who thinks himself wise  O heavens! is a great fool.
author: Voltaire

quote: The power that is supported by force alone will have cause often to tremble.
author: Louis Kossuth

quote: Force is all-conquering  but its victories are short-lived.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quote: Force and not opinion is the queen of the world  but it is opinion that uses the force.
author: Pascal

quote: In life  as in chess  forethought wins.
author: Charles Buxton

quote: If a man take no thought about what is distant  he will find sorrow near at hand.
author: Confucius

quote: Forethought we may have  undoubtedly  but not foresight.
author: Napoleon

quote: Look ere thou leap  see ere thou go.
author: Thomas Tusser

quote: I am forgotten as a dead man out of mind: I am like a broken vessel.
author: Bible

quote: And when he is out of sight  quickly also he is out of mind.
author: Thomas a Kempis

quote: The world forgetting  by the world forgot.
author: Alexander Pope

quote: There is no remembrance which time does not obliterate  nor pain which death does not terminate.
author: Miguel de Cervantes

quote: If I forget thee  O Jerusalem  let my right hand forget her cunning.
author: Bible

quote: Who is the Forgotten Man? He is the clean  quiet  virtuous  domestic citizen  who pays his debts and his taxes and is never heard of out of his little circle.
author: William Graham Sumner

quote: How we remember  what we remember  and why we remember form the most personal map of our individuality.
author: Christina Baldwin

quote: Reconciliation is more beautiful than victory.
author: Violeta Barrios de Chamorro

quote: The stupid neither forgive nor forget  the naive forgive and forget  the wise forgive  but do not forget.
author: Thomas Szasz

quote: Forgetting is the cost of living cheerfully.
author: Zoe Akins

quote: Forgiveness is the key to action and freedom.
author: Hannah Arendt

quote: "I can forgive  but I cannot forget" is only another way of saying  "I will not forgive." Forgiveness ought to be like a canceled note-torn in two and burned up so that it never can be shown against one.
author: Henry Ward Beecher

quote: Life appears to me too short to be spent in nursing animosity or registering wrong.
author: Charlotte Bronte

quote: Anger repressed can poison a relationship as surely as the crudest words.
author: Dr. Joyce Brothers

quote: Forgiveness means letting go of the past.
author: Gerald Jampolsky

quote: I know now that patriotism is not enough  I must have no hatred and bitterness toward anyone.
author: Edith Cavell

quote: Stretch out your hand! Let no human soul wait for a benediction.
author: Marie Corelli

quote: Nobody ever forgets where he buried a hatchet.
author: Kin Hubbard

quote: Anger as soon as fed is dead  'tis starving makes it fat.
author: Emily Dickinson

quote: Once a woman has forgiven a man  she must not reheat his sins for breakfast.
author: Marlene Dietrich

quote: There's no point in burying a hatchet if you're going to put up a marker on the site.
author: Sydney J. Harris

quote: As long as you don't forgive  who and whatever it is will occupy a rent-free space in your mind.
author: Isabelle Holland

quote: Courage and clemency are equal virtues.
author: Mary Delariviere Manley

quote: One may have been a fool  but there's no foolishness like being bitter.
author: Kathleen Norris

quote: Not the power to remember  but its very opposite  the power to forget  is a necessary condition for our existence.
author: Sholem Asch

quote: Once a woman has forgiven a man  she must not reheat his sins for breakfast.
author: Marlene Dietrich

quote: Keeping score of old scores and scars  getting even and one-upping  always make you less than you are.
author: Malcolm Forbes

quote: Forgiveness is all-powerful. Forgiveness heals all ills.
author: Catherine Ponder

quote: The forgiving state of mind is a magnetic power for attracting good.
author: Catherine Porter

quote: Forgiveness is an act of the will  and the will can function regardless of the temperature of the heart.
author: Corrie ten Boom

quote: To be wronged is nothing unless you continue to remember it.
author: Confucius

quote: Who understands much  forgives much.
author: Madame de Stael

quote: Forgiveness is the act of admitting we are like other people.
author: Christina Baldwin

quote: Grace fills empty spaces  but it can only enter where there is a void to receive it  and it is grace itself which makes this void.
author: Simone Weil

quote: Know all and you will pardon all.
author: Thomas a Kempis

quote: People are more than the worst thing they have ever done in their lives.
author: Helen Prejean

quote: The secret of forgiving everything is to understand nothing.
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: Speak not against anyone whose burden you have not weighed yourself.
author: Marion Zimmer Bradley

quote: Nothing's easier than believing we understand experiences we've never had.
author: Gwen Bristow

quote: The heart has always the pardoning power.
author: Anne-Sophie Swetchine

quote: To understand is to forgive  even oneself.
author: Alexander Chase

quote: To what extent is any given man morally responsible for any given act? We do not know.
author: Dr. Alexis Carrel

quote: The weak can never forgive. Forgiveness is the attribute of the strong.
author: Mohandas Gandhi

quote: Only the brave know how to forgive. ... A coward never forgave  it is not in his nature.
author: Laurence Sterne

quote: Any man can seek revenge  it takes a king or prince to grant a pardon.
author: Arthur J. Rehrat

quote: To be angry about trifles is mean and childish  to rage and be furious is brutish  and to maintain perpetual wrath is akin to the practice and temper of devils  but to prevent and suppress rising resentment is wise and glorious  is manly and divine.
author: Isaac Watts

quote: Hatred is a death wish for the hated  not a life wish for anything else.
author: Audre Lorde

quote: Hatred is a passion requiring one hundred times the energy of love. Keep it for a cause  not an individual. Keep it for intolerance  injustice  stupidity. For hatred is the strength of the sensitive. Its power and its greatness depend on the selflessness of its use.
author: Olive Moore

quote: Resentment is the "number one" offender. It destroys more alcoholics than anything else. From it stem all forms of spiritual disease  for we have been not only mentally and physically ill  we have been spiritually sick.
author: Alcoholics Anonymous

quote: To oppose something is to maintain it.
author: Ursula K. LeGuin

quote: Dwelling on the negative simply contributes to its power.
author: Shirley MacLaine

quote: To carry a grudge is like being stung to death by one bee.
author: William H. Walton

quote: Resentments are burdens we don't need to carry.
author: Anonymous

quote: The enslaver is enslaved  the hater  harmed.
author: Marianne Moore

quote: By putting his hand around my neck  he slowly strangled himself.
author: Minako Ohba

quote: The one who deals the mortal blow receives the mortal wound.
author: Maude Parker

quote: Without forgiveness life is governed ... by an endless cycle of resentment and retaliation.
author: Robert Assaglioli

quote: Malice drinks one-half of its own poison.
author: Marcus Annaeus Seneca

quote: I tell you  there is no such thing as creative hate!
author: Willa Cather

quote: Reject hatred without hating.
author: Mary Baker Eddy

quote: Hate would destroy him who hated.
author: Louis L'Amour

quote: In hatred as in love  we grow like the thing we brood upon. What we loathe  we graft into our very soul.
author: Mary Renault

quote: Resentment is weak and lowers your self-esteem.
author: Barbara Sher

quote: Hate is a prolonged form of suicide.
author: Douglas V. Steere

quote: Hatred is like fire-it makes even light rubbish deadly.
author: George Eliot

quote: You cannot shake hands with a clenched fist.
author: Indira Gandhi

quote: Hate is all a lie  there is no truth in hate.
author: Kathleen Norris

quote: Hate is not a good counselor.
author: Victoria Wolff

quote: Bitterness imprisons life  love releases it.
author: Harry Emerson Fosdick

quote: If the will remains in protest  it stays dependent on that which it is protesting against.
author: Rollo May

quote: Hate smolders and eventually destroys  not the hated but the hater.
author: Dorothy Thompson

quote: It is almost impossible to throw dirt on someone without getting a little on yourself.
author: Abigail Van Buren

quote: If you hate a person  you hate something in him that is part of yourself.
author: Hermann Hesse

quote: Fire destroys that which feeds it.
author: Simone Weil

quote: You cannot hate other people without hating yourself.
author: Oprah Winfrey

quote: Whom they have injured  they also hate.
author: Marcus Annaeus Seneca

quote: Rage and bitterness do not foster femininity. They harden the heart and make the body sick.
author: Marion Woodman

quote: I used to store my anger and it affected my play. Now I get it out. I'm never rude to my playing partner. I'm very focused on the ball. Then it's over.
author: Helen Alfredsson

quote: Anger is a short madness.
author: Horace

quote: My mother used to say  "He who angers you conquers you."
author: Elizabeth Kenny

quote: The angry people are those people who are most afraid.
author: Dr. Robert Anthony

quote: Anger as soon as fed is dead  'tis starving makes it fat.
author: Emily Dickinson

quote: Anger dwells only in the bosom of fools.
author: Albert Einstein

quote: Anger and worry are the enemies of clear thought.
author: Madeleine Brent

quote: Holding on to anger is like grasping a hot coal with the intent of throwing it at someone else  you are the one who gets burned.
author: Buddha

quote: Anger is a killing thing: it kills the man who angers  for each rage leaves him less than he had been before-it takes something from him.
author: Louis L'Amour

quote: Something of vengeance I had tasted for the first time  as aromatic wine it seemed  on swallowing  warm and racy  its after-flavor  metallic and corroding  gave me a sensation as if I had been poisoned.
author: Charlotte Bronte

quote: Revenge could steal a man's life until there was nothing left but emptiness.
author: Louis L'Amour

quote: Revenge may not be a particularly high consciousness-oriented activity.
author: Carrie Fisher

quote: The human heart in its perversity finds it hard to escape hatred and revenge.
author: Moses Luzzatto

quote: A man can lose sight of everything else when he's bent on revenge  and it ain't worth it.
author: Louis L'Amour

quote: The whole human race loses by every act of personal vengeance.
author: Rae Foley

quote: Forgiveness is the sweetest revenge.
author: Isaac Friedmann

quote: One forgives to the degree that one loves.
author: Francois de La Rochefoucauld

quote: One is as one is  and the love that can't encompass both is a poor sort of love.
author: Marya Mannes

quote: Forgiveness is the final form of love.
author: Reinhold Niebuhr

quote: The days are too short even for love  how can there be enough time for quarreling?
author: Margaret Gatty

quote: Forgiveness is the most tender part of love.
author: John Sheffield

quote: The best proof of love is trust.
author: Dr. Joyce Brothers

quote: Love is an act of endless forgiveness  a tender look which becomes a habit.
author: Peter Ustinov

quote: We are told that people stay in love because of chemistry  or because they remain intrigued with each other  because of many kindnesses  because of luck. ... But part of it has got to be forgiveness and gratefulness.
author: Ellen Goodman

quote: For me it's not possible to forget  and I don't understand people who  when the love is ended  can bury the other person in hatred or oblivion. For me  a man I have loved becomes a kind of brother.
author: Jeanne Moreau

quote: Today I forgive all those who have ever offended me. I give my love to all thirsty hearts  both to those who love me and to those who do not love me.
author: Paramahansa Yogananda

quote: Experience is how life catches up with us and teaches us to love and forgive each other.
author: Judy Collins

quote: We never ask God to forgive anybody except when we haven't.
author: Elbert Hubbard

quote: Forgiveness is God's command.
author: Martin Luther

quote: God will forgive me  that is His business.
author: Heinrich Heine

quote: God will forgive me the foolish remarks I have made about Him just as I will forgive my opponents the foolish things they have written about me  even though they are spiritually as inferior to me as I to thee  O God!
author: Heinrich Heine

quote: Let all bitterness  and wrath  and anger  and clamour  and evil speaking  be put away from you  with all malice  and be ye kind to one another  tenderhearted  forgiving one another  even as God  for Christ's sake  hath forgiven you.
author: Bible

quote: I have looked on a lot of women with lust. I've committed adultery in my heart many times. God recognizes I will do this and forgives me.
author: Jimmy Carter

quote: How Forgiveness Helps Us Forgiveness is the answer to the child's dream of a miracle by which what is broken is made whole again  what is soiled is again made clean.
author: Dag Hammarskjold

quote: Forgiveness is all-powerful. Forgiveness heals all ills.
author: Catherine Ponder

quote: Those who are free of resentful thoughts surely find peace.
author: Buddha

quote: I can have peace of mind only when I forgive rather than judge.
author: Gerald Jampolsky

quote: The forgiving state of mind is a magnetic power for attracting good.
author: Catherine Ponder

quote: Judge not  that ye be not judged.
author: Bible

quote: It is in pardoning that we are pardoned.
author: Saint Francis of Assisi

quote: Forgiving those who hurt us is the key to personal peace.
author: G. Weatherly

quote: Forgive all who have offended you  not for them  but for yourself.
author: Harriet Uts Nelson

quote: To forgive is the highest  most beautiful form of love. In return  you will receive untold peace and happiness.
author: Robert Muller

quote: Forgiveness is the key to action and freedom.
author: Hannah Arendt

quote: Forgiveness is the way to true health and happiness.
author: Gerald Jampolsky

quote: Humanity is never so beautiful as when praying for forgiveness  or else forgiving another.
author: Jean Paul Richter

quote: Those who can't forget are worse off than those who can't remember.
author: Anonymous

quote: Forgiveness is the remission of sins. For it is by this that what has been lost  and was found  is saved from being lost again.
author: Saint Augustine

quote: I can pardon everybody's mistakes except my own.
author: Marcus Porcius Cato

quote: If you haven't forgiven yourself something  how can you forgive others?
author: Dolores Huerta

quote: The moment an individual can accept and forgive himself  even a little  is the moment in which he becomes to some degree lovable.
author: Eugene Kennedy

quote: They may not deserve forgiveness  but I do.
author: Anonymous

quote: I forgive myself for having believed for so long that... I was never good enough to have  get  be what I wanted.
author: Ceanne DeRohan

quote: How unhappy is he who cannot forgive himself.
author: Publilius Syrus

quote: I learned that true forgiveness includes total self-acceptance. And out of acceptance wounds are healed and happiness is possible again.
author: Catharine Marshall

quote: Every man treats himself as society treats the criminal.
author: Harvey Fergusson

quote: To understand is to forgive  even oneself.
author: Alexander Chase

quote: Give us this day our daily bread. And forgive us our debts  as we forgive our debtors.
author: Bible

quote: He that cannot forgive others breaks the bridge over which he must pass himself  for every man has need to be forgiven.
author: Thomas Fuller

quote: Always forgive your enemies  nothing annoys them so much.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: Forgiveness is the noblest vengeance.
author: H. G. Bohn

quote: There is no revenge so complete as forgiveness.
author: Josh Billings

quote: Many promising reconciliations have broken down because while both parties came prepared to forgive  neither party came prepared to be forgiven.
author: Charles William

quote: Forgiveness is man's deepest need and highest achievement.
author: Horace Bushnell

quote: Abandon your animosities and make your sons Americans!
author: Robert E. Lee

quote: Her breasts and arms ached with the beauty of her own forgiveness.
author: Meridel Le Sueur

quote: Life is an adventure in forgiveness.
author: Norman Cousins

quote: The cut worm forgives the plow.
author: William Blake

quote: Forgiveness is the highest and most difficult of all moral lessons.
author: Joseph Jacobs

quote: The fragrance of the violet sheds on the heel that has crushed it.
author: Mark Twain

quote: How shall I love the sin  yet keep the sense  And love the offender  yet detest the offence?
author: Alexander Pope

quote: Forgiveness is the giving  and so the receiving  of life.
author: George Macdonald

quote: Who would care to question the ground of forgiveness or compassion?
author: Joseph Conrad

quote: O friends  I pray tonight  Keep not your kisses for my dead cold brow. The way is lonely  let me feel them now. Think gently of me  I am travel-worn  My faltering feet are pierced with many a thorn. Forgive! O hearts estranged  forgive  I plead! When ceaseless bliss is mine I shall not need The tenderness for which I long tonight.
author: Belle Eugenia Smith

quote: Let us forget and forgive injuries.
author: Miguel de Cervantes

quote: Even a stopped clock is right twice a day.
author: Marie von Ebner-Eschenbach

quote: It is easier to forgive an enemy than a friend.
author: Madame Dorothee Deluzy

quote: It is very easy to forgive others their mistakes  it takes more grit and gumption to forgive them for having witnessed your own.
author: Jessamyn West

quote: When you pray for anyone you tend to modify your personal attitude toward him.
author: Norman Vincent Peale

quote: Forgiving means to pardon the unpardonable  faith means believing the unbelievable  and hoping means to hope when things are hopeless.
author: G. K. Chesterton

quote: To err is human  to forgive  divine.
author: Alexander Pope

quote: Normal day  let me be aware of the treasure you are. Let me learn from you  love you  bless you before you depart. Let me not pass you by in quest of some rare and perfect tomorrow. Let me hold you while I may  for it may not always be so. One day I shall dig my nails into the earth  or bury my face in the pillow  or stretch myself taut  or raise my hands to the sky and want  more than all the world  your return.
author: Mary Jean Iron

quote: The unthankful heart... discovers no mercies  but let the thankful heart sweep through the day and  as the magnet finds the iron  so it will find  in every hour  some heavenly blessings!
author: Henry Ward Beecher

quote: Joy is what happens to us when we allow ourselves to recognize how good things really are.
author: Marianne Williamson

quote: Good heavens  of what uncostly material is our earthly happiness composed ... if we only knew it. What incomes have we not had from a flower  and how unfailing are the dividends of the seasons.
author: James Russell Lowell

quote: Be on the lookout for mercies. The more we look for them  the more of them we will see.... Better to loose count while naming your blessings than to lose your blessings to counting your troubles.
author: Maltbie D. Babcock

quote: The man who thinks his wife  his baby  his house  his horse  his dog  and himself severely unequalled  is almost sure to be a good-humored person.
author: Oliver Wendell Holmes

quote: Every dog has its day  but it's not every dog that knows when he's having it.
author: Winifred Gordon

quote: We must give ourselves more earnestly and intelligently and generously than we have to the happy duty of appreciation.
author: Mariana Griswold Van Rensselaer

quote: There is nothing so bitter that a patient mind cannot find some solace for it.
author: Marcus Annaeus Seneca

quote: I thank You God for this most amazing day  for the leaping greenly spirits of trees and a blue true dream of sky  and for everything which is natural which is infinite which is yes.
author: e. e. cummings

quote: My private measure of success is daily. If this were to be the last day of my life would I be content with it? To live in a harmonious balance of commitments and pleasures is what I strive for.
author: Jane Rule

quote: Yes  there is a Nirvanah: it is in leading your sheep to a green pasture  and in putting your child to sleep  and in writing the last line of your poem.
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: Blessed are those who can give without remembering and take without forgetting.
author: Elizabeth Asquith Bibesco

quote: That daily life is really good one appreciates when one wakes from a horrible dream  or when one takes the first outing after a sickness. Why not realize it now?
author: William Lyon Phelps

quote: Thank God every morning when you get up that you have something to do which must be done  whether you like it or not.
author: Charles Kingsley

quote: When I first open my eyes upon the morning meadows and look out upon the beautiful world  I thank God I am alive.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: Each day comes bearing its own gifts. Untie the ribbons.
author: Ruth Ann Schabacker

quote: We can be thankful to a friend for a few acres or a little money  and yet for the freedom and command of the whole earth  and for the great benefits of our being  our life  health  and reason  we look upon ourselves as under no obligation.
author: Marcus Annaeus Seneca

quote: When something does not insist on being noticed  when we aren't grabbed by the collar or struck on the skull by a presence or an event  we take for granted the very things that most deserve our gratitude.
author: Cynthia Ozick

quote: Why do some people always see beautiful skies and grass and lovely flowers and incredible human beings  while others are hard-pressed to find anything or any place that is beautiful?
author: Leo Buscaglia

quote: Most human beings have an almost infinite capacity for taking things for granted.
author: Aldous Huxley

quote: My country ... gave me schooling  independence of action and opportunity for service. ... I am indebted to my country beyond any human power to repay.
author: Herbert Hoover

quote: Dwell upon the brightest parts in every prospect... and strive to be pleased with the present circumstances.
author: Abraham Tucker

quote: We are never either so wretched or so happy as we say we are.
author: Honore de Balzac

quote: The best things are nearest: breath in your nostrils  light in your eyes  flowers at your feet  duties at your hand  the path of God just before you. Then do not grasp at the stars  but do life's plain  common work as it comes  certain that daily duties and daily bread are the sweetest things of life.
author: Robert Louis Stevenson

quote: Is life so wretched? Isn't it rather your hands which are too small  your vision which is muddled? You are the one who must grow up.
author: Dag Hammarskjold

quote: Looking for Silver Linings Our real blessings often appear to us in the shape of pains  losses and disappointments.
author: Joseph Addison

quote: Most of my major disappointments have turned out to be blessings in disguise. So whenever anything bad does happen to me  I kind of sit back and feel  well  if I give this enough time  it'll turn out that this was good  so I shan't worry about it too much.
author: William Gaines

quote: Sometimes the best deals are the ones you don't make.
author: Bill Veeck

quote: The advantages of a losing team: (i) There is everything to hope for and nothing to fear  (2.) Defeats do not disturb one's sleep. (3) An occasional victory is a surprise and a delight. (4) There is no danger of any club passing you. (5) You are not asked fifty times a day  "What was the score?"  people take it for granted that you lost.
author: Elmer E. Bates

quote: That which does not kill me makes me stronger.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: Not being beautiful was the true blessing. ... Not being beautiful forced me to develop my inner resources. The pretty girl has a handicap to overcome.
author: Golda Meir

quote: The difficulties  hardships and trials of life  the obstacles ... are positive blessings. They knit the muscles more firmly  and teach self-reliance.
author: William Matthews

quote: Many a man curses the rain that falls upon his head  and knows not that it brings abundance to drive away hunger.
author: Saint Basil

quote: Trouble is only opportunity in work clothes.
author: Henry J. Kaiser

quote: Adversity has the same effect on a man that severe training has on the pugilist: it reduces him to his fighting weight.
author: Josh Billings

quote: You will never be the person you can be if pressure  tension and discipline are taken out of your life.
author: Dr. James G. Bilkey

quote: Some troubles  like a protested note of a solvent debtor  bear interest.
author: Honore de Balzac

quote: Failure changes for the better  success for the worse.
author: Marcus Annaeus Seneca

quote: The basis of optimism is sheer terror.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: No evil is without its compensation ... it is not the loss itself  but the estimate of the loss  that troubles us.
author: Marcus Annaeus Seneca

quote: Let me embrace thee  sour adversity  for wise men say it is the wisest course.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: Give thanks for sorrow that teaches you pity  for pain that teaches you courage-and give exceeding thanks for the mystery which remains a mystery still-the veil that hides you from the infinite  which makes it possible for you to believe in what you cannot see.
author: Robert Nathan

quote: A Christian could even give thanks for Hell  because Hell was a threat and a warning to keep him in the right way.
author: Anonymous

quote: To every disadvantage there is a corresponding advantage.
author: W. Clement Stone

quote: Too many people miss the silver lining because they're expecting gold.
author: Maurice Setter

quote: If you count all your assets  you always show a profit.
author: Robert Quillen

quote: Too happy would you be  did ye but know your own advantages!
author: Virgil

quote: Much unhappiness results from our inability to remember the nice things that happen to us.
author: W. N. Rieger

quote: If we go down into ourselves  we find that we possess exactly what we desire.
author: Simone Weil

quote: Be grateful for yourself... be thankful.
author: William Saroyan

quote: Keep a grateful journal. Every night  list five things that you are grateful for. What it will begin to do is change your perspective of your day and your life.
author: Oprah Winfrey

quote: There is no wealth but life.
author: John Ruskin

quote: Just to be is a blessing. Just to live is holy.
author: Abraham Heschel

quote: Life may be hard  but it's also wonderful.
author: Small Change

quote: I like living. I have sometimes been wildly  despairingly  acutely miserable  racked with sorrow  but through it all I still know quite certainly that just to be alive is a grand thing.
author: Agatha Christie

quote: Be glad of life because it gives you the chance to love  and to work  and to play and to look up at the stars.
author: Henry Van Dyke

quote: To be alive  to be able to see  to walk ... it's all a miracle. I have adapted the technique of living life from miracle to miracle.
author: Arthur Rubinstein

quote: This is another day! Are its eyes blurred With maudlin grief for any wasted past? A thousand thousand failures shall not daunt! Let dust clasp dust  death  death  I am alive!
author: Don Marquis

quote: The mere sense of living is joy enough.
author: Emily Dickinson

quote: However mean your life is  meet it and live it  do not shun it and call it hard names. It is not so bad as you are. It looks poorest when you are richest. The fault-finder will find faults even in Paradise. Love your life.
author: Henry David Thoreau

quote: Life is the first gift  love is the second  and understanding the third.
author: Marge Piercy

quote: To have a full stomach and fixed income are no small things .
author: Elbert Hubbard

quote: For one mother  joy is the quiet pleasure found in gently rubbing shampoo into her young child's hair. For another woman it's taking a long walk alone  while for yet another it's reveling in a much-anticipated vacation.
author: Eileen Stukane

quote: How can they say my life is not a success? Have I not for more than sixty years gotten enough to eat and escaped being eaten?
author: Logan Pearsall Smith

quote: Sunshine is delicious  rain is refreshing  wind braces us up  snow is exhilarating  there is really no such thing as bad weather  only different kinds of good weather.
author: John Ruskin

quote: Only a stomach that rarely feels hungry scorns common things.
author: Horace

quote: My gratitude for good writing is unbounded  I'm grateful for it the way I'm grateful for the ocean.
author: Anne Lamott

quote: Is it so small a thing to have enjoyed the sun  to have lived light in the spring  to have loved  to have thought  to have done?
author: Matthew Arnold

quote: When something does not insist on being noticed  when we aren't grabbed by the collar or struck on the skull by a presence or an event  we take for granted the very things that most deserve our gratitude.
author: Cynthia Ozick

quote: You say grace before meals. All right. But I say grace before the concert and the opera  and grace before the play and pantomime  and grace before I open a book  and grace before sketching  painting  swimming  fencing  boxing  walking  playing  dancing and grace before I dip the pen in the ink.
author: G. K. Chesterton

quote: Thank God for dirty dishes  they have a tale to tell. While other folks go hungry  we're eating pretty well. With home  and health  and happiness  we shouldn't want to fuss  For by this stack of evidence  God's very good to us.
author: Anonymous

quote: It is strange what a contempt men have for the joys that are offered them freely.
author: Georges Duhamel

quote: Grateful for the blessing lent of simple tastes and mind content!
author: Oliver Wendell Holmes

quote: An easy thing  O Power Divine  To thank thee for these gifts of Thine  For summer's sunshine  winter's snow  For hearts that kindle  thoughts that glow  But when shall I attain to this- To thank Thee for the things I miss?
author: Thomas W. Higginson

quote: People call me an optimist  but I'm really an appreciator ... years ago  I was cured of a badly infected finger with antibiotics when once my doctor could have recommended only a hot water soak or  eventually  surgery.... When I was six years old and had scarlet fever  the first of the miracle drugs  sulfanilamide  saved my life. I'm grateful for computers and photocopiers ... I appreciate where we've come from.
author: Julian Simon

quote: If only the people who worry about their liabilities would think about the riches they do possess  they would stop worrying. Would you sell both your eyes for a million dollars ... or your two legs ... or your hands ... or your hearing? Add up what you do have  and you'll find that you won't sell them for all the gold in the world. The best things in life are yours  if you can appreciate yourself.
author: Dale Carnegie

quote: We can be thankful to a friend for a few acres or a little money  and yet for the freedom and command of the whole earth  and for the great benefits of our being  our life  health  and reason  we look upon ourselves as under no obligation.
author: Marcus Annaeus Seneca

quote: Health is ... a blessing that money cannot buy.
author: Izaak Walton

quote: Happiness lies  first of all  in health.
author: George William Curtis

quote: A sound mind in a sound body is a short but full description of a happy state in this world.
author: John Locke

quote: Health is the vital principle of bliss.
author: James Thomson

quote: If you can't be thankful for what you receive  be thankful for what you escape.
author: Anonymous

quote: Even though we can't have all we want  we ought to be thankful we don't get all we deserve.
author: Anonymous

quote: Happy the man who can count his sufferings.
author: Ovid

quote: Happiness is composed of misfortunes avoided.
author: Alphonse Karr

quote: Considering the fortune you might have lost  you'll have to admit you're rich already.
author: John Rothchild

quote: I thank Thee first because I was never robbed before  second  because although they took my purse they did not take my life  third  because although they took my all  it was not much  and fourth because it was I who was robbed  and not I who robbed.
author: Matthew Henry

quote: Think of the ills from which you are exempt.
author: Joseph Joubert

quote: A man should always consider ... how much more unhappy he might be than he is.
author: Joseph Addison

quote: The happiness of any given life is to be measured not by its joys and pleasures  but by the extent to which it has been free from suffering  from positive evil.
author: Arthur Schopenhauer

quote: Better to suffer than to die.
author: Jean de la Fontaine

quote: Better a little fire to warm us than a great one to burn us.
author: Thomas Fuller

quote: It isn't important to come out on top. What matters is to come out alive.
author: Bertolt Brecht

quote: He who limps still walks.
author: Stanislaw Lee

quote: I have gout  asthma  and seven other maladies  but am otherwise very well.
author: Sydney Smith

quote: Luckily  I never feel at one time more than half my pains.
author: Joseph Joubert

quote: Pain is no longer pain when it is past.
author: Margaret Junkin Preston

quote: We are content to forgo joy when pain is also lost.
author: Latin proverb

quote: The happiest is he who suffers the least pain  the most miserable  he who enjoys the least pleasure.
author: Jean-Jacques Rousseau

quote: Happiness is not being pained in body  or troubled in mind.
author: Thomas Jefferson

quote: The end of pain we take as happiness.
author: Giacomo Leopardi

quote: You can be happy indeed if you have breathing space from pain.
author: Giacomo Leopardi

quote: The summit of pleasure is the elimination of all that gives pain.
author: Epicurus

quote: I seek the utmost pleasure and the least pain.
author: Plautus

quote: A prudent man will think more important what fate has conceded to him  than what it has denied.
author: Baltasar Gracian

quote: It is better to be looked over than overlooked.
author: Mae West

quote: Blessed are those who can give without remembering and take without forgetting.
author: Elizabeth Asquith Bibesco

quote: He is a man of sense who does not grieve for what he has not  but rejoices in what he has.
author: Epictetus

quote: Enjoy the successes that you have  and don't be too hard on yourself when you don't do well. Too many times we beat up on ourselves. Just relax and enjoy it.
author: Patty Sheehan

quote: For everything you have missed  you have gained something else.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: Few love what they may have.
author: Ovid

quote: The knowledge that something remains yet unenjoyed impairs our enjoyment of the good before us.
author: Samuel Johnson

quote: May we never let the things we can't have  or don't have  spoil our enjoyment of the things we do have and can have.
author: Richard L. Evans

quote: It is not customary to love what one has.
author: Anatole France

quote: The talent for being happy is appreciating and liking what you have  instead of what you don't have.
author: Woody Allen

quote: Happy thou art not  for what thou hast not  still thou striv'est to get  and what thou hast  forget'est.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: Men ... always think that something they are going to get is better than what they have got.
author: John Oliver Hobbes

quote: When we cannot get what we love  we must love what is within our reach.
author: French proverb

quote: Take full account of the excellencies which you possess  and in gratitude remember how you would hanker after them  if you had them not.
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: A wise man cares not for what he cannot have.
author: Anonymous

quote: A man can refrain from wanting what he has not  and cheerfully make the best of a bird in the hand.
author: Marcus Annaeus Seneca

quote: Long only for what you have.
author: Andre Gide

quote: The tulip is  among flowers  what the peacock is among birds. A tulip lacks scent  a peacock has an unpleasant voice. The one takes pride in its garb  the other in its tail.
author: French proverb

quote: Slight not what is near though aiming at what is far.
author: Euripides

quote: Greediness of getting more  deprives ... the enjoyment of what it had got.
author: Thomas Sprat

quote: There is a mortal breed most full of futility. In contempt of what is at hand  they strain into the future  hunting impossibilities on the wings of ineffectual hopes.
author: Pindar

quote: What you really value is what you miss  not what you have.
author: Jorge Luis Borges

quote: While you fear missing a meal  you aren't fully aware of the meals you do eat.
author: Dan Millman

quote: To be upset over what you don't have is to waste what you do have.
author: Ken Keyes

quote: If there's no bread  cakes are very good.
author: Spanish proverb

quote: Not what we have  but what we enjoy  constitutes our abundance.
author: J. Petit-Senn

quote: Not what we have  but what we use  not what we see  but what we choose-these are the things that mar or bless human happiness.
author: Joseph Fort Newton

quote: The happiness which is lacking makes one think even the happiness one has unbearable.
author: Joseph Roux

quote: We always have enough to be happy if we are enjoying what we do have- and not worrying about what we don't have.
author: Ken Keyes

quote: Welcome everything that comes to you  but do not long for anything else.
author: Andre Gide

quote: The superiority of the distant over the present is only due to the mass and variety of the pleasures that can be suggested  compared with the poverty of those that can at any time be felt.
author: George Santayana
