quote: Give me the avowed  the erect and manly foe  Bold I can meet  perhaps may turn the blow  But of all plagues  good Heaven  thy wrath can send  Save  oh save me from the candid friend!
author: George Canning

quote: A good friend can tell you what is the matter with you in a minute. He may not seem such a good friend after telling.
author: Arthur Brisbane

quote: Do not remove a fly from your friend's forehead with a hatchet.
author: Chinese proverb

quote: Friendship will not stand the strain of very much good advice for very long.
author: Robert Lynd

quote: There is not so good an understanding between any two  but the exposure by the one of a serious fault in the other will produce a misunderstanding in proportion to its heinousness.
author: Henry David Thoreau

quote: A friend should be a master at guessing and keeping still.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: A cheerful friend is like a sunny day  which sheds its brightness on all around.
author: John Lubbock

quote: The more we love our friends  the less we flatter them  it is by excusing nothing that pure love shows itself.
author: Moliere

quote: It is the weak and confused who worship the pseudo-simplicities of brutal directness.
author: Marshall McLuhan

quote: What a wonderful thing it is to have a good friend. He identifies your innermost desires  and spares you the embarrassment of disclosing them to him yourself.
author: Jean de la Fontaine

quote: I always felt that the great high privilege  relief and comfort of friendship was that one had to explain nothing.
author: Katherine Mansfield

quote: Nobody who is afraid of laughing  and heartily too  at his friend can be said to have a true and thorough love for him.
author: Julius Charles Hare

quote: Don't believe your friends when they ask you to be honest with them. All they really want is to be maintained in the good opinion they have of themselves.
author: Albert Camus

quote: Only friends will tell you the truths you need to hear to make ... your life bearable.
author: Francine Du Plessix Gray

quote: Keep the other person's well-being in mind when you feel an attack of soul-purging truth coming on.
author: Betty White

quote: If it's very painful for you to criticize your friends-you're safe in doing it. But if you take the slightest pleasure in it  that's the time to hold your tongue.
author: Alice Duer Miller

quote: Flatterers look like friends  as wolves like dogs.
author: George Chapman

quote: Friendship may sometimes step a few paces in advance of truth.
author: Walter Savage Landor

quote: A friend is a person with whom I may be sincere. Before him  I may think aloud.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: Oh  the comfort  the inexpressible comfort of feeling safe with a person  having neither to weigh thoughts nor measure words  but pouring them all out  just as they are  chaff and grain together  certain that a faithful hand will take and sift them  keep what is worth keeping  and with a breath of kindness blow the rest away.
author: Dinah Maria Mulock Craik

quote: One's friends are that part of the human race with which one can be human.
author: George Santayana

quote: I should like to tell you again of my bitter troubles so that mutually  by recounting our grief  we can lighten each other's sorrow.
author: The Kanteletar

quote: There are only two people who can tell you the truth about yourself-an enemy who has lost his temper and a friend who loves you dearly.
author: Antisthenes

quote: Since we are mortal  friendships are best kept to a moderate level  rather than sharing the very depths of our souls.
author: Hippolytus

quote: Forget your woes when you see your friend.
author: Priscian

quote: Those that lack friends to open themselves unto are cannibals of their own hearts.
author: Francis Bacon

quote: Laugh  and the world laughs with you  weep and you weep alone.
author: Ella Wheeler Wilcox

quote: When good cheer is lacking  our friends will be packing.
author: Anonymous

quote: We have no more right to put our discordant states of mind into the lives of those around us and rob them of their sunshine and brightness than we have to enter their houses and steal their silverware.
author: Julia Seton

quote: 'Tis the privilege of friendship to talk nonsense  and have her nonsense respected.
author: Charles Lamb

quote: There is no man that imparteth his joys to his friends  but he joyeth the more  and no man that imparteth his griefs to his friends  but he grieveth the less.
author: Francis Bacon

quote: I am treating you as my friend  asking you to share my present minuses in the hope I can ask you to share my future pluses.
author: Katherine Mansfield

quote: The most beautiful discovery true friends make is that they can grow separately without growing apart.
author: Elizabeth Foley

quote: Trouble is a sieve through which we sift our acquaintances. Those too big to pass through are our friends.
author: Arlene Francis

quote: I have come to esteem history as a component of friendships. In my case at least friendships are not igneous but sedimentary.
author: Jane Howard

quote: No man can be happy without a friend  nor be sure of his friend till he is unhappy.
author: Thomas Fuller

quote: Friendship makes prosperity more brilliant  and lightens adversity by dividing and sharing it.
author: Cicero

quote: The friend of my adversity I shall always cherish most. I can better trust those who helped to relieve the gloom of my dark hours than those who are so ready to enjoy with me the sunshine of my prosperity.
author: Ulysses S. Grant

quote: The growth of true friendship may be a lifelong affair.
author: Sarah Orne Jewett

quote: Constant use had not worn ragged the fabric of their friendship.
author: Dorothy Parker

quote: Even where the affections are not strongly moved by any superior excellence  the companions of our childhood always possess a certain power over our minds which hardly any later friend can obtain.
author: Mary Wollstonecraft Shelley

quote: In prosperity our friends know us  in adversity we know our friends.
author: John Churton Collins

quote: 0 summer friendship  whose flat-tering leaves shadowed us in our prosperity  With the least gust  drop off in the autumn of adversity.
author: Philip Massinger

quote: 1 loathe a friend ... who takes his friend's prosperity but will not voyage with him in his grief.
author: Euripides

quote: In prosperity friends do not leave you unless desired  whereas in adversity they stay away of their own accord.
author: Demetrius

quote: There's no friend like someone who has known you since you were five.
author: Anne Stevenson

quote: Lots of people want to ride with you in the limo  but what you want is someone who will take the bus with you when the limo breaks down.
author: Oprah Winfrey

quote: I have lost friends  some by death ... others by sheer inability to cross the street.
author: Virginia Woolf

quote: Friendship was given by nature to be an assistant to virtue  not a companion in vice.
author: Cicero

quote: We are fonder of visiting our friends in health than in sickness. We judge less favorably of their characters when any misfortune happens to them  and a lucky hit  either in business or reputation  improves even their personal appearance in our eyes.
author: William Hazlitt

quote: Women rely on friends. ... That's where we draw sustenance and find safety. We can count on our women friends when we need a good laugh or a good cry.
author: Cokie Roberts

quote: The shifts of fortune test the reliability of friends.
author: Cicero

quote: Never befriend the oppressed unless you are prepared to take on the oppressor.
author: Ogden Nash

quote: Trouble shared is trouble halved.
author: Dorothy L. Sayers

quote: Real friendship is shown in times of trouble  prosperity is full of friends.
author: Euripides

quote: Instead of loving your enemies  treat your friends a little better.
author: Edgar Watson Howe

quote: One enemy is too many  a hundred friends too few.
author: Anonymous

quote: Faithful are the wounds of a friend  but the kisses of an enemy are deceitful.
author: Bible

quote: Friends come and go  enemies linger.
author: Anonymous

quote: The proper office of a friend is to side with you when you are in the wrong. Nearly everybody will side with you when you are in the right.
author: Mark Twain

quote: It isn't easy to be the person who sometimes has to try to preserve your happiness at the expense of your fun.
author: Margaret Culkin Banning

quote: I like a highland friend who will stand by me not only when I am in the right  but when I am a little in the wrong.
author: Sir Walter Scott

quote: I don't care a damn for your loyal service when you think I am right  when I really want it most is when you think I am wrong.
author: General Sir John Monash

quote: Nature has been for me  for as long as I remember  a source of solace  inspiration  adventure  and delight  a home  a teacher  a companion.
author: Lorraine Anderson

quote: However deep our devotion may be to parents or to children  it is our contemporaries alone with whom understanding is instinctive and entire.
author: Vera Brittain

quote: Writers seldom choose as friends those self-contained characters who are never in trouble  never unhappy or ill  never make mistakes  and always count their change when it is handed to them.
author: Catherine Drinker Bowen

quote: Fortify yourself with a flock of friends! You can select them at random  write to one  dine with one  visit one  or take your problems to one. There is always at least one who will understand  inspire  and give you the lift you may need at the time.
author: George Matthew Adams

quote: Many a person has held close  throughout their entire lives  two friends that always remained strange to one another  because one of them attracted by virtue of similarity  the other by difference.
author: Emil Ludwig

quote: Nothing is more limiting than a closed circle of acquaintanceship where every avenue of conversation has been explored and social exchanges are fixed in a known routine.
author: A. J. Cronin

quote: A man with few friends is only half-developed  there are whole sides of his nature which are locked up and have never been expressed. He cannot unlock them himself  he cannot even discover them  friends alone can stimulate him and open him.
author: Randolph Bourne

quote: Friendship is mutual blackmail elevated to the level of love.
author: Robin Morgan

quote: Scratch a lover  and find a foe.
author: Dorothy Parker

quote: We need old friends to help us grow old and new friends to help us stay young.
author: Letty Cottin Pogrebin

quote: Friendship is almost always the union of a part of one mind with a part of another  people are friends in spots.
author: George Santayana

quote: It's the folks that depend on us for this and for the other that we most do miss.
author: Mary Webb

quote: Time's passage through the memory is like molten glass that can be opaque or crystallize at any given moment at will: a thousand days are melted into one conversation  one glance  one hurt  and one hurt can be shattered and sprinkled over a thousand.
author: Gloria Naylor

quote: Kind words can be short and easy to speak  but their echoes are truly endless.
author: Mother Teresa

quote: The wise man's ... friendship is capable of going to extremes with many people  evoked as it is by many qualities.
author: Charles Dudley Warner

quote: Now and then one sees a face which has kept its smile pure and undefiled. Such a smile transfigures  such a smile  if the artful but know it  is the greatest weapon a face can have.
author: Helen Hunt Jackson

quote: I cannot concentrate all my friendship on any single one of my friends because no one is complete enough in himself.
author: Anais Nin

quote: We need two kinds of acquaintances  one to complain to  while we boast to the others. -Logan Pearsall Smith No one person can possibly combine all the elements supposed to make up what everyone means by friendship.
author: Francis Marion Crawford

quote: Every organism requires an environment of friends  partly to shield it from violent changes  and partly to supply it with its wants.
author: Alfred North Whitehead

quote: Without wearing any mask we are conscious of  we have a special face for each friend.
author: Oliver Wendell Holmes

quote: An old friend never can be found  and nature has provided that he cannot easily be lost.
author: Samuel Johnson

quote: Years and years of happiness only make us realize how lucky we are to have friends that have shared and made that happiness a reality.
author: Robert E. Frederick

quote: To those who know thee not  no words can paint! And those who know thee  know all words are faint!
author: Hannah Moore

quote: It is one of the blessings of old friends that you can afford to be stupid with them.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: Old friends are the great blessing of one's later years. ... They have a memory of the same events and have the same mode of thinking.
author: Horace Walpole

quote: As in the case of wines that improve with age  the oldest friendships ought to be the most delightful.
author: Cicero

quote: There is a magic in the memory of a schoolboy friendship. It softens the heart  and even affects the nervous system of those who have no heart.
author: Benjamin Disraeli

quote: It is great to have friends when one is young  but indeed it is still more so when you are getting old. When we are young  friends are  like everything else  a matter of course. In the old days we know what it means to have them.
author: Edvard Grieg

quote: When you are young and without success  you have only a few friends. Then  later on  when you are rich and famous  you still have a few ... if you are lucky.
author: Pablo Picasso

quote: Old friends  we say  are best  when some sudden disillusionment shakes our faith in a new comrade.
author: Gelett Burgess

quote: Friends and wine should be old.
author: Spanish proverb

quote: Forsake not an old friend  for the new is not comparable to him  a new friend is as new wine.
author: Bible

quote: To be capable of steady friendship or lasting love are the two greatest proofs  not only of goodness of heart  but of strength of mind.
author: William Hazlitt

quote: Ah  how good it feels! The hand of an old friend.
author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

quote: The best mirror is an old friend.
author: Anonymous

quote: I keep my friends as misers do their treasure because  of all the things granted us by wisdom  none is greater or better than friendship.
author: Pietro Aretino

quote: There is only one thing better than making a new friend  and that is keeping an old one.
author: Elmer G. Letterman

quote: The only way not to break a friendship is not to drop it.
author: Julie Holz

quote: To throw away an honest friend is  as it were  to throw your life away.
author: Sophocles

quote: Hold a true friend with both your hands.
author: Nigerian proverb

quote: None is so rich as to throw away a friend.
author: Turkish proverb

quote: Those friends thou hast  and their adoption tried  grapple them to thy soul with hoops of steel.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: True friendship is like sound health  the value of it is seldom known until it be lost.
author: Charles Caleb Colton

quote: We die as often as we lose a friend.
author: Publilius Syrus

quote: Affinities are rare. They come but a few times in a life. It is awful to risk losing one when it arrives.
author: Florence H. Winterburn

quote: Rather throw away that which is dearest to you  your own life  than turn away a good friend.
author: Sophocles

quote: Thine own friend  and thy father's friend  forsake not.
author: Bible

quote: The best way to keep your friends is not to give them away.
author: Wilson Mizner

quote: I never enter a new company without the hope that I may discover a friend  perhaps the friend  sitting there with an expectant smile. That hope survives a thousand disappointments.
author: Arthur Christopher Benson

quote: Since there is nothing so well worth having as friends  never lose a chance to make them.
author: Francesco Guicciardini

quote: If a man does not make new acquaintances as he advances through life  he will soon find himself left alone.
author: Samuel Johnson

quote: A man's growth is seen in the successive choirs of his friends.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: Every man passes his life in the search after friendship.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: What causes us to like new acquaintances is not so much weariness of our old ones  or the pleasure of change  as disgust at not being sufficiently admired by those who know us too well  and the hope of being admired more by those who do not know so much about us.
author: Francois de La Rochefoucauld

quote: A new acquaintance is like a new book. I prefer it  even if bad  to a classic.
author: Benjamin Disraeli

quote: To cement a new friendship  especially between foreigners or persons of a different social world  a spark with which both were secretly charged must fly from person to person  and cut across the accidents of place and time.
author: George Santayana

quote: A new friend is like new wine  when it has aged you will drink it with pleasure.
author: Apocrypha

quote: He alone has lost the art to live who cannot win new friends.
author: S. Weir Mitchell

quote: Five years from now you will be pretty much the same as you are today except for two things: the books you read and the people you get close to.
author: Charles Jones

quote: I want no men around me who have not the knack of making friends.
author: Frank A. Vanderlip

quote: Yes'm  old friends is always best  'less you can catch a new one that's fit to make an old one out of.
author: Sarah Orne Jewett

quote: Many a friendship-long  loyal  and self-sacrificing-rested at first upon no thicker a foundation than a kind word.
author: Frederick W. Faber

quote: A home-made friend wears longer than one you buy in the market.
author: Austin O'Malley

quote: The best time to make friends is before you need them.
author: Ethel Barrymore

quote: Accident counts for much in companionship  as in marriage.
author: Henry Adams

quote: We need new friends. Some of us are cannibals who have eaten their old friends up  others must have ever-renewed audiences before whom to re-enact an ideal version of their lives.
author: Logan Pearsall Smith

quote: In a world that holds books and babies and canyon trails  why should one condemn oneself to live day in  day out with people one does not like  and sell oneself to chaperone and correct them?
author: Ruth Benedict

quote: A true friend is the greatest of all blessings  and that which we take the least care of all to acquire.
author: Francois de La Rochefoucauld

quote: A man must eat a peck of salt with his friend before he knows him.
author: Miguel de Cervantes

quote: Have but few friends  though many acquaintances.
author: Anonymous

quote: One who's our friend is fond of us  one who's fond of us isn't necessarily our friend.
author: Marcus Annaeus Seneca

quote: Make all good men your well-wishers  and then  in the years' steady sifting  some of them will turn into friends.
author: John Hay

quote: Distrust all those who love you extremely upon a very slight acquaintance and without any viable reason.
author: Lord Chesterfield

quote: We often choose a friend as we do a mistress  for no particular excellence in themselves  but merely from some circumstance that flatters our self-love.
author: William Hazlitt

quote: How casually and unobservedly we make all our most valued acquaintances.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: Be courteous to all  but intimate with few  and let those few be well-tried before you give them your confidence.
author: George Washington

quote: Be slow to fall into friendship  but when thou art in  continue firm and constant.
author: Socrates

quote: How often we find ourselves turning our backs on our actual friends  that we may go and meet their ideal cousins.
author: Henry David Thoreau

quote: Let him have the key of thy heart  who hath the lock of his own.
author: Sir Thomas Browne

quote: Books and friends should be few but good.
author: Anonymous

quote: Sudden friendship  sure repentance.
author: Anonymous

quote: As there are some flowers which you should smell but slightly to extract all that is pleasant in them ... so there are some men with whom a slight acquaintance is quite sufficient to draw out all that is agreeable  a more intimate one would be unsafe and unsatisfactory.
author: Walter Savage Landor

quote: Acquaintance I would have  but when it depends not on the number  but the choice of friends.
author: Abraham Cowley

quote: Always set high value on spontaneous kindness. He whose inclination prompts him to cultivate your friendship of his own accord will love you more than one whom you have been at pains to attach to you.
author: Samuel Johnson

quote: Friendship that flames goes out in a flash.
author: Thomas Fuller

quote: Trouble is a sieve through which we sift our acquaintances. Those too big to pass through are our friends.
author: Arlene Francis

quote: Wishing to be friends is quick work  but friendship is a slow-ripening fruit.
author: Aristotle

quote: Be slow in choosing a friend  slower in changing.
author: Benjamin Franklin

quote: Every man is like the company he is wont to keep.
author: Euripides

quote: Treat your friends as you do your picture  and place them in their best light.
author: Jennie Jerome Churchill

quote: Character builds slowly  but it can be torn down with incredible swiftness.
author: Faith Baldwin

quote: He that lies down with dogs shall rise up with fleas.
author: Anonymous

quote: If I wanted to become a tramp  I would seek information and advice from the most successful tramp I could find. If I wanted to become a failure  I would seek advice from men who have never succeeded. If I wanted to succeed in all things  I would look around me for those who are succeeding  and do as they have done.
author: Joseph Marshall Wade

quote: Better fare hard with good men than feast with bad.
author: Thomas Fuller

quote: By associating with good and evil persons a man acquires the virtues and vices which they possess  even as the wind blowing over different places takes along good and bad odors.
author: The Panchatantra

quote: I would prefer as a friend a good man who is ignorant than one more clever who is evil  too.
author: Euripides

quote: Tell me whom you frequent  and I will tell you who you are.
author: French proverb

quote: Associate yourself with men of good quality if you esteem your own reputation  for 'tis better to be alone than in bad company.
author: George Washington

quote: Go to the place where the thing you wish to know is native  your best teacher is there. ... You acquire a language most readily in the country where it is spoken  you study mineralogy best among miners  and so with everything else.
author: Johann von Goethe

quote: Tell me thy company  and I'll tell thee what thou art.
author: Miguel de Cervantes

quote: Who friendship with a knave hath made  is judged a partner in the trade.
author: John Gay

quote: The lion is ashamed  it's true  when he hunts with the fox.
author: Gotthold Ephraim Lessing

quote: He that walketh with wise men shall be wise.
author: Solomon

quote: Life is partly what we make it  and partly what it is made by the friends we choose.
author: Tehyi Hsieh

quote: If you always live with those who are lame  you will yourself learn to limp.
author: Latin proverb

quote: Keep good men company  and you shall be of their number.
author: Anonymous

quote: A man becomes like those whose society he loves.
author: Hindu proverb

quote: A wise man associating with the vicious becomes an idiot  a dog traveling with good men becomes a rational being.
author: Arab proverb

quote: It is better to weep with wise men than to laugh with fools.
author: Spanish proverb

quote: A wise man may look ridiculous in the company of fools.
author: Thomas Fuller

quote: 111 company is like a dog  who dirts those most whom he loves best.
author: Jonathan Swift

quote: Satan's friendship reaches to the prison door.
author: Turkish proverb

quote: Have no friends not equal to yourself.
author: Confucius

quote: Friendship is seldom lasting but between equals  or where the superiority on one side is reduced by some equivalent advantage on the other.
author: Samuel Johnson

quote: Friendship neither finds nor makes equals.
author: Publilius Syrus

quote: You cannot be friends upon any other terms than upon the terms of equality.
author: Woodrow Wilson

quote: A man is known by the company he keeps.
author: Anonymous

quote: Friendship is nothing else than an accord in all things  human and divine  conjoined with mutual goodwill and affection.
author: Cicero

quote: Friendship is a union of spirits  a marriage of hearts  and the bond there of virtue.
author: Samuel Johnson

quote: To associate with other like-minded people in small purposeful groups is for the great majority of men and women a source of profound psychological satisfaction.
author: Aldous Huxley

quote: Shared joys make a friend  not shared sufferings.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: Seek those who find your road agreeable  your personality and mind stimulating  your philosophy acceptable  and your experiences helpful. Let those who do not  seek their own kind.
author: Jean-Henri Fabre

quote: To like and dislike the same things  this is what makes a solid friendship.
author: Sallust

quote: Friendship is only a reciprocal conciliation of interests.
author: Francois de La Rochefoucauld

quote: Friendship needs a certain parallelism of life  a community of thought  a rivalry of aim.
author: Henry Adams

quote: True friends ... face in the same direction  toward common projects  interests  goals.
author: C. S. Lewis

quote: That friendship may be at once fond and lasting  there must not only be equal virtue on each part  but virtue of the same kind  not only the same end must be proposed  but the same means must be approved by both.
author: Samuel Johnson

quote: It is characteristic of spontaneous friendship to take on  without enquiry and almost at first sight  the unseen doings and unspoken sentiments of our friends  the part known gives us evidence enough that the unknown part cannot be much amiss.
author: George Santayana

quote: Men only become friends by community of pleasures.
author: Samuel Johnson

quote: If we would build on a sure foundation in friendship  we must love friends for their sake rather than for our own.
author: Charlotte Bronte

quote: The reward of friendship is itself. The man who hopes for anything else does not understand what true friendship is.
author: Saint Alfred of Rievaulx

quote: That friendship will not continue to the end which is begun for an end.
author: Francis Quarles

quote: The friendships which last are those wherein each friend respects the other's dignity to the point of not really wanting anything from him.
author: Cyril Connolly

quote: My best friend is the man who in wishing me well wishes it for my sake.
author: Aristotle

quote: I have friends in overalls whose friendship I would not swap for the favor of the kings of the world.
author: Thomas A. Edison

quote: I have always differentiated between two types of friends  those who want proofs of friendship  and those who do not. One kind loves me for myself  and the others for themselves.
author: Gerard de Nerval

quote: Friendship  like credit  is highest where it is not used.
author: Elbert Hubbard

quote: Friendship without self-interest is one of the rare and beautiful things of life.
author: James F. Byrnes

quote: I have learned that to have a good friend is the purest of all God's gifts  for it is a love that has no exchange of payment.
author: Frances Farmer

quote: If you press me to say why I loved him  I can say no more than because he was he  and I was I.
author: Michel de Montaigne

quote: He who looks for advantage out of friendship strips it all of its nobility.
author: Marcus Annaeus Seneca

quote: Friendship is always a sweet responsibility  never an opportunity.
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: Friendship with oneself is all-important  because without it one cannot be friends with anyone else.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

quote: In a friend you find a second self.
author: Isabelle Norto

quote: Of my friends  I am the only one I have left.
author: Terence

quote: I desire so to conduct the affairs of this administration that if at the end ... I have lost every other friend on earth  I shall at least have one friend left  and that friend shall be down inside of me.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quote: Be a friend to thyself  and others will be so too.
author: Thomas Fuller

quote: Friendship is neither a formality nor a mode: it is rather a life.
author: David Grayson

quote: Friendship is one mind in two bodies.
author: Mencius

quote: Friendship's a noble name  'tis love refined.
author: Susannah Centlivre

quote: A friend is  as it were  a second self.
author: Cicero

quote: Friend: One who knows all about you and loves you just the same.
author: Elbert Hubbard

quote: A friend is like a poem.
author: Persian proverb

quote: A friend is a present you give to yourself.
author: Robert Louis Stevenson

quote: A friend is someone you can do nothing with  and enjoy it.
author: The Optimist

quote: Friendship needs no words-it is solitude delivered from the anguish of loneliness.
author: Dag Hammarskjold

quote: A friend may well be reckoned the masterpiece of nature.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: Two friends-two bodies with one soul inspired.
author: Homer

quote: In poverty and other misfortunes of life  true friends are a sure refuge.
author: Aristotle

quote: Friendship is a single soul dwelling in two bodies.
author: Aristotle

quote: A faithful friend is the medicine of life.
author: Apocrypha

quote: Friends are a second existence.
author: Baltasar Gracian

quote: A real friend helps us think our best thoughts  do our noblest deeds  be our finest selves.
author: Anonymous

quote: Friendship is a furrow in the sand.
author: Tongan proverb

quote: Friendship is love without his wings!
author: Lord Byron

quote: True friendship is self-love at second hand.
author: William Hazlitt

quote: The real friend is he or she who can share all our sorrow and double our joys.
author: B. C. Forbes

quote: Friendship is a word the very sight of which in print makes the heart warm.
author: Augustine Birrell

quote: Most men's friendships are too inarticulate.
author: William James

quote: My philosophy is: anyone or anything that gives you knowledge inspires you.
author: Gabrielle Reece

quote: The feeling of friendship is like that of being comfortably filled with roast beef.
author: Samuel Johnson

quote: The easiest kind of relationship for me is with ten thousand people. The hardest is with one.
author: Joan Baez

quote: It is easier to forgive an enemy than it is a friend.
author: Madame Dorothee Deluzy

quote: To act the part of a true friend requires more conscientious feeling than to fill with credit and complacency any other station or capacity in social life.
author: Sarah Ellis

quote: Friendship is an art  and very few persons are born with a natural gift for it.
author: Kathleen Norris

quote: Female friendships that work are relationships in which women help each other belong to themselves.
author: Louise Bernikow

quote: The language of friendship is not words  but meanings.
author: Henry David Thoreau

quote: I can trust my friends. ... These people force me to examine myself  encourage me to grow.
author: Cher

quote: We challenge one another to be funnier and smarter. ... It's the way friends make love to one another.
author: Annie Gottlieb

quote: If I made it  it's half because I was game enough to take a lot of punishment along the way and half because there were a lot of people who cared enough to help me.
author: Althea Gibson

quote: Iron sharpeneth iron  so a man sharp-eneth the countenance of his friend.
author: Bible

quote: A friend can tell you things you don't want to tell yourself.
author: Frances Ward Weller

quote: I suppose there is one friend in the life of each of us who seems not a separate person  however dear and beloved  but an expansion  an interpretation  of one's self.
author: Edith Wharton

quote: Love demands infinitely less than friendship.
author: George Jean Nathan

quote: Good company upon the road is the shortest cut.
author: Anonymous

quote: The particular human chain we're a part of is central to our individual identity.
author: Elizabeth Stone

quote: No person is your friend who demands your silence  or denies your right to grow.
author: Alice Walker

quote: The best preservative to keep the mind in health is the faithful admonition of a friend.
author: Francis Bacon

quote: What is thine is mine  and all mine is thine.
author: Plautus

quote: Do not protect yourself by a fence  but rather by your friends.
author: Czech proverb

quote: If our friends' idealizations of us need the corrective of our own experience  it may be true also that our own sordid view of our lives needs the corrective of our friends' idealizations.
author: Oscar W. Firkins

quote: In meeting again after a separation  acquaintances ask after our outward life  friends after our inner life.
author: Marie von Ebner-Eschenbach

quote: In real friendship the judgment  the genius  the prudence of each party become the common property of both.
author: Maria Edgeworth

quote: The thicker one gets with some people  the thinner they become.
author: Puzant Thomain

quote: When our friends are alive  we see the good qualities they lack  dead  we remember only those they possessed.
author: J. Petit-Senn

quote: The company makes the feast.
author: Anonymous

quote: When one friend washes another  both become clean.
author: Dutch proverb

quote: I observed once to Goethe ... that when a friend is with us we do not think the same of him as when he is away. He replied  "Yes! because the absent friend is yourself  and he exists only in your head  whereas the friend who is present has an individuality of his own  and moves according to laws of his own  which cannot always be in accordance with those which you form for yourself."
author: Arthur Schopenhauer

quote: In reality  we are still children. We want to find a playmate for our thoughts and feelings.
author: Dr. Wilhelm Stekhel

quote: Love me  please  I love you  I can bear to be your friend. So ask of me anything ... I am not a tentative person. Whatever I do  I give up my whole self to it.
author: Edna Saint Vincent Millay

quote: Most of our misfortunes are comments of our friends upon them.
author: Charles Caleb Colton

quote: Greater love hath no man than this  that a man lay down his life for his friends.
author: Bible

quote: Animals are such agreeable friends- they ask no questions  they pass no criticisms.
author: George Eliot

quote: Great friendship is never without anxiety.
author: Marie de Rabutin-Chantal

quote: One out of four people in this country is mentally imbalanced. Think of your three closest friends and if they seem okay  then you're the one.
author: Ann Landers

quote: She is one of my best friends. Why  I've known her ever since we were the same age.
author: Galen Cooper

quote: You never know how many friends you have until you rent a cottage at the beach.
author: Kraig Kristofferson

quote: There are two kinds of people in the world: those who come into a room and say  "Here I am!" and those who come in and say  "Oh  there you are."
author: Anonymous

quote: Friends are folks who excuse you when you have made a fool of yourself.
author: Anonymous

quote: A word of advice  don't give it.
author: A. J. Volicos

quote: Advice is what we ask for when we already know the answer but wish we didn't.
author: Erica Jong

quote: Here's a toast to someone who's truly a best friend - a person who goes around telling good things behind your back.
author: Elmer Pasta

quote: My friend thought he was not gonna make it. Then he started thinking positive. Now he's positive he's not gonna make it.
author: Brother Sammy Shore

quote: We cherish our friends not for their ability to amuse us but for ours to amuse them.
author: Evelyn Waugh

quote: There ain't no surer way to find out whether you like people or hate them than to travel with them.
author: Mark Twain

quote: It takes a long time to grow an old friend.
author: John Leonard

quote: With friends like you - who needs enemas.
author: Anonymous

quote: Here's a dime. Call all your friends.
author: Tom Meany

quote: We are both great men  but I have succeeded better in keeping it a profound secret than he has.
author: Bill Nye

quote: As the psychiatrist said to the cannibal at the end of a session: "Your problem is easy you're just fed up with people."
author: Anonymous

quote: Should auld acquaintances be forgot  And never brought to mind? Should auld acquaintance be forgot  And days o'auld lang syne?
author: James Drummond Burns

quote: Friendship  peculiar boon of Heaven  The noble mind's delight and pride  To men and angels only given  To all the lower world denied.
author: Samuel Johnson

quote: What is thine is mine  and all mine is thine.
author: Plautus

quote: Saul and Jonathan were lovely and pleasant in their lives  and in their death they were not divided.
author: Bible

quote: Madam  I have been looking for a person who disliked gravy all my life  let us swear eternal friendship.
author: Sydney Smith

quote: Be slow to fall into friendship  but when thou art in continue firm and constant.
author: Socrates

quote: True friendship is a plant of slow growth and must undergo and withstand the shocks of adversity before it is entitled to the appellation.
author: George Washington

quote: By their fruits ye shall know them.
author: Matthew

quote: The ripest fruit first falls.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: The best way to remember your wife's birthday is to forget it once.
author: E. Joseph Cossman

quote: She's too young for Medicare and too old for me to care.
author: Anonymous

quote: Gray hair is God's graffiti.
author: Bill Cosby

quote: I lived in Miami for a while  in a section with a lot of really old people. The average age in my apartment house was dead.
author: Gabe Kaplan

quote: Good Americans  when they die  go to Paris.
author: T. G. Appleton

quote: We had a very successful trip to Russia we got back.
author: Bob Hope

quote: Enjoy life. Think of all the women who passed up dessert on the Titanic.
author: Anonymous

quote: Everybody should believe in something  I believe I'll have another drink.
author: Anonymous

quote: I know lots more old drunks than old doctors.
author: Joe E. Lewis

quote: I'm a one-drink woman  two at the most  three I'm under the table  four I'm under the host.
author: Anonymous

quote: My doctor said I look like a million dollars - green and wrinkled.
author: Red Skelton

quote: Condoms aren't completely safe. A friend of mine was wearing one . . . and got hit by a bus.
author: Bob Rubin

quote: My doctor gave me six months to live  but when I couldn't pay the bill  he gave me six months more.
author: Walter Mattbau

quote: I can't believe that out of a hundred thousand sperm  you were the quickest.
author: Steven Pearl

quote: I hope you live to be as old as your jokes.
author: Anonymous

quote: My wife is the most wonderful woman in the world  and that's not just my opinion - it's hers.
author: Anonymous

quote: she: Before we got married  you told me you were well-off. he: I was  and I didn't know it.
author: Jacob Braude

quote: A good marriage would be between a blind wife and a deaf husband.
author: Michel de Montaigne

quote: Why did God make man before he made woman? Because he didn't want any advice on how to do it.
author: Anonymous

quote: The best way to remember your wife's birthday is to forget it once.
author: E. Joseph Cossman

quote: She's too young for Medicare and too old for me to care.
author: Anonymous

quote: Gray hair is God's graffiti.
author: Bill Cosby

quote: I lived in Miami for a while  in a section with a lot of really old people. The average age in my apartment house was dead.
author: Gabe Kaplan

quote: Good Americans  when they die  go to Paris.
author: T. G. Appleton

quote: We had a very successful trip to Russia we got back.
author: Bob Hope

quote: Enjoy life. Think of all the women who passed up dessert on the Titanic.
author: Anonymous

quote: Everybody should believe in something  I believe I'll have another drink.
author: Anonymous

quote: I know lots more old drunks than old doctors.
author: Joe E. Lewis

quote: I'm a one-drink woman  two at the most  three I'm under the table  four I'm under the host.
author: Anonymous

quote: My doctor said I look like a million dollars - green and wrinkled.

author: Anonymous

quote: When all else is lost  the future still remains.
author: Christian Nestell Bovee

quote: Tis the sunset of life gives me mystical lore  And coming events cast their shadows before.
author: Thomas Campbell

quote: I never think of the future. It comes soon enough.
author: Albert Einstein

quote: I know of no way of judging the future but by the past.
author: Patrick Henry

quote: The present is great with the future
author: Baron von Leibnitz

quote: Trust no Future  howe'er pleasant! Let the dead Past bury its dead!
author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

quote: Go forth to meet the shadowy Future without fear and with a manly heart.
author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

quote: Take therefore no thought for the morrow  for the morrow shall take thought for the things of itself. Sufficient unto the day is the evil thereof.
author: Matthew

quote: There was the Door to which I found no key  There was the Veil through which I might not see.
author: Omar Khayyam

quote: There was a wise man in the East whose constant prayer was that he might see today with the eyes of tomorrow.
author: Alfred Mercier

quote: I believe the future is only the past again  entered through another gate.
author: Arthur Wing Pinero

quote: Till the sun grows cold  And the stars are old  And the leaves of the Judgment Book unfold.
author: Bayard Taylor

quote: The race is not always to the swift nor the battle to the strong - but that's the way to bet.
author: Anonymous

quote: There is but one good throw upon the dice  which is to throw them away.
author: Paul Chatfield

quote: By gaming we lose both our time and treasure - two things most precious to the life of man.
author: Owen Felltham

quote: Man is a gaming animal.
author: Charles Lamb

quote: Keep flax from fire  youth from gaming.
author: Benjamin Franklin

quote: It [gaming] is the child of avarice  the brother of iniquity  and the father of mischief.
author: George Washington

quote: Play out the game  act well your part  and if the gods have blundered  we will not.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: Business is more exciting than any game.
author: Lord Beaverbrook

quote: Divorce is a game played by lawyers.
author: Cary Grant

quote: Poetry is a mug's game.
author: T. S. Eliot

quote: The game isn't over until it's over.
author: Yogi Berra

quote: I never lost a game. I just ran out of time.
author: Bobby Layne

quote: Most ball games are lost  not won.
author: Casey Stengel

quote: In the game of life nothing is less important than the score at half time.
author: Anonymous

quote: The game of life is not so much in holding a good hand as playing a poor hand well.
author: H. T. Leslie

quote: The game is not worth the candle.

author: French proverb

quote: A garden is a lovesome thing - God wot! Rose plot  Fringed pool  Fern grot -  The veriest school Of peace  and yet the fool Contends that God is not. -  Not God in gardens! When the sun is cool? Nay  but I have a sign! 'Tis very sure God walks in mine.
author: Thomas Edward Brown

quote: God the first garden made  and the first city Cain.
author: Abraham Cowley

quote: The Lord God planted a garden eastward in Eden  and there he put the man whom he had formed.
author: Anonymous

quote: One is nearer God's heart in a garden Than anywhere else on earth.
author: Dorothy Frances Gurney

quote: The difference between genius and stupidity is that genius has its limits.
author: Anonymous

quote: The genius of Einstein leads to Hiroshima.
author: Pablo Picasso

quote: Genius  in truth  means little more than the faculty of perceiving in an unhabitual way.
author: William James

quote: Genius as such can neither be explained nor treated away  only  at times  its delay and inhibition and its perversion to destructive or self-destructive ends.
author: Erik Erikson

quote: To believe your own thought  to believe that what is true for you in your private heart is true for all men - that is genius.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: Doing easily what others find is difficult is talent  doing what is impossible for talent is genius.
author: Henri Frederic Amiel

quote: It takes immense genius to represent  simply and sincerely  what we see in front of us.
author: Edmond Duranty

quote: Results! Why  man  I have gotten a lot of results. I know several thousand things that won't work.
author: Thomas A. Edison

quote: The parting genius is with sighing sent.
author: Anonymous

quote: Every man of genius is considerably helped by being dead.
author: Robert S. Lund

quote: In the republic of mediocrity  genius is dangerous.
author: Robert G. Ingersoll

quote: We define genius as the capacity for productive reaction against one's training.
author: Bernard Berenson

quote: Before I was a genius I was a drudge.
author: Ignace Jan Paderewski

quote: In every work of genius we recognize our own rejected thoughts  they come back to us with a certain alienated majesty.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: Genius develops in quiet places  character out in the full current of human life.
author: Goethe

quote: Men of genius are the worst possible models for men of talent.
author: Murray D. Edwards

quote: The public is wonderfully tolerant. It forgives everything except genius.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: When a true genius appears in the world you may know him by this sign  that the dunces are all in confederacy against him.
author: Jonathan Swift

quote: Talent is that which is in a man's power  genius is that in whose power a man is.
author: James Russell Lowell

quote: There is a thin line between genius and insanity. I have erased this line.
author: Oscar Levant

quote: Improvement makes straight roads  but the crooked roads without improvement are roads of genius.
author: William Blake

quote: Geniuses are the luckiest of mortals because what they must do is the same as what they most want to do.
author: W. H. Auden

quote: Everyone is a genius at least once a year  a real genius has his original ideas closer together.
author: G. C. Lichtenberg

quote: The true genius is a mind of large general powers  accidentally determined to some particular direction.
author: Samuel Johnson

quote: The mark of genius is an incessant activity of mind. Genius is a spiritual greed.
author: V. S. Pritchett

quote: Genius is an African who dreams up snow.
author: Vladimir Nabokov

quote: Sometimes men come by the name of genius in the same way that certain insects come by the name of centipede - not because they have a hundred feet  but because most people can't count above fourteen.
author: G. C. Lichtenberg

quote: Too often we forget that genius ... depends upon the data within its reach  that Archimedes could not have devised Edison's inventions.
author: Ernest Dimnet

quote: There is no great genius without a mixture of madness.
author: Aristotle

quote: Genius is only great patience.
author: Anonymous

quote: Genius is one per cent inspiration and ninety-nine per cent perspiration.
author: Thomas Alva Edison

quote: Genius does what it must  and talent does what it can.
author: Edward G. Bulwer-Lytton

quote: Gift  like genius  I often think only means an infinite capacity for taking pains.
author: Ellice Hopkins

quote: Genius is a promontory jutting out of the infinite.
author: Victor Hugo

quote: Three-fifths of him genius and two-fifths sheer fudge.
author: James Russell Lowell

quote: The lamp of genius burns quicker than the lamp of life.
author: Friedrich von Schiller

quote: The poet's scrolls will outlive the monuments of stone. The Genius survives  all else is claimed by death.
author: Edmund Spenser

quote: A gentleman is man who can disagree without being disagreeable.
author: Anonymous

quote: The gentleman is a Christian product.
author: George H. Calvert

quote: Once a gentleman  always a gentleman.
author: Charles Dickens

quote: Propriety of manners and consideration for others are the two main characteristics of a gentleman.
author: Benjamin Disraeli

quote: To make a fine gentleman  several trades are required  but chiefly a barber.
author: Oliver Goldsmith

quote: Let us put Germany  so to speak  in the saddle! you will see that she can ride.
author: Otto von Bismarck

quote: We Germans will never produce another Goethe  but we may produce another Caesar.
author: Oswald Spengler

quote: Act decidedly and take the consequences. No good is ever done by hesitation.
author: Thomas Henry Huxley

quote: How lovely to think that no one need wait a moment  we can start now  start slowly changing the world!
author: Anne Frank

quote: To know what has to be done  then do it  comprises the whole philosophy of practical life.
author: Sir William Osier

quote: If you want to do something  do it!
author: Plautus

quote: Something must happen!
author: Heinrich Boll

quote: Putting off an easy thing makes it hard. Putting off a hard thing makes it impossible.
author: George Claude Lorimer

quote: Delay always breeds danger  and to protract a great design is often to ruin it.
author: Miguel de Cervantes

quote: The wise man does at once what the fool does finally.
author: Baltasar Gracian

quote: In putting off what one has to do  one runs the risk of never being able to do it.
author: Charles Baudelaire

quote: Getting an idea should be like sitting down on a pin  it should make you jump up and do something.
author: E. L. Simpson

quote: Procrastination is opportunity's assassin.
author: Victor Kiam

quote: To do anything in this world worth doing  we must not stand back shivering and thinking of the cold and danger  but jump in and scramble through as well as we can.
author: Sydney Smith

quote: The man who will not execute his resolutions when they are fresh upon him can have no hope from them afterwards  they will be dissipated  lost and perish in the hurry and scurry of the world  or sunk in the slough of indolence.
author: Maria Edgeworth

quote: Why always  "not yet"? Do flowers in spring say  "not yet"?
author: Norman Douglas

quote: We are very near to greatness: one step and we are safe  can we not take the leap?
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: The keen spirit seizes the prompt occasion.
author: Hannah Moore

quote: The hour is ripe  and yonder lies the way.
author: Virgil

quote: Delay not to seize the hour!
author: Aeschylus

quote: I was seldom able to see an opportunity until it had ceased to be one.
author: Mark Twain

quote: This one makes a net  this one stands and wishes. Would you like to make a bet which one gets the fishes?
author: Chinese rhyme

quote: Inspirations never go in for long engagements  they demand immediate marriage to action.
author: Brendan Francis

quote: If we really want to live  we'd better start at once to try.
author: W. H. Auden

quote: The rewards in business go to the man who does something with an idea.
author: William Benton

quote: The important thing is somehow to begin.
author: Henry Moore

quote: Eighty percent of success is showing up.
author: Woody Allen

quote: As long as you can start  you are all right. The juice will come.
author: Ernest Hemingway

quote: The way to get ahead is to start now.
author: William Feather

quote: Begin doing what you want to do now.
author: Marie Beynon Ray

quote: It is no good hearing an inner voice or getting an inner prompting if you do not immediately act on that inner prompting.
author: David Spangler

quote: Even if you're on the right track  you'll get run over if you just sit there.
author: Will Rogers

quote: The first step is the hardest.
author: Anonymous

quote: The art of writing is the art of applying the seat of the pants to the seat of the chair.
author: Mary Heaton Vorse

quote: Every beginning is hard.
author: Anonymous

quote: A journey of a thousand miles must begin with a single step.
author: Chinese proverb

quote: Whenever you take a step forward  you are bound to disturb something.
author: Indira Gandhi

quote: If you miss the first buttonhole  you will not succeed in buttoning up your coat.
author: Johann von Goethe

quote: If you don't place your foot on the rope  you'll never cross the chasm.
author: Anonymous

quote: He who is outside the door has already a good part of his journey behind him.
author: Dutch proverb

quote: The beginning is half of every action.
author: Greek proverb

quote: The man who removes a mountain begins by carrying away small stones.
author: Chinese proverb

quote: Everyone who got where he is had to begin where he was.
author: Robert Louis Stevenson

quote: Change your life today. Don't gamble on the future  act now  without delay.
author: Simone de Beauvoir

quote: The most important thing about getting somewhere is starting right where we are.
author: Bruce Barton

quote: Sometimes we look so intently toward the pinnacle that we stumble over the steps leading to it. Development begins just where you are.
author: Mrs. Herman Stanley

quote: Few begin with anything like a clear view of what they want to do  and the fortune they seek may come in a very different form from that which they have kept in view.
author: The Independent

quote: The most effective way to do it  is to do it.
author: Toni Cade Bambara

quote: Beginnings are apt to be shadowy.
author: Rachel Carson

quote: We will not know unless we begin.
author: Howard Zinn

quote: Let us watch well our beginnings  and results will manage themselves.
author: Alexander Clark

quote: You cannot contribute anything to the ideal condition of mind and heart known as Brotherhood  however much you preach  posture  or agree  unless you live it.
author: Faith Baldwin

quote: The secret of getting ahead is getting started.
author: Sally Berger

quote: To always be intending to live a new life  but never to find time to set about it  this is as if a man should put off eating and drinking and sleeping from one day and night to another  till he is starved and destroyed.
author: John Tillotson

quote: To choose is also to begin.
author: Starhawk

quote: Knowing is not enough  we must apply. Willing is not enough  we must do.
author: Johann von Goethe

quote: Wisdom is harder to do than it is to know.
author: Yula Moses

quote: Justice is a concept. Muscle is the reality.
author: Linda Blandford

quote: No one has a right to sit down and feel hopeless. There's too much work to do.
author: Dorothy Day

quote: Do noble things  do not dream them all day long.
author: Charles Kingsley

quote: That is the principal thing: not to remain with the dream  with the intention  with the being in the mood  but always forcibly to convert it into all things.
author: Rainer Maria Rilke

quote: Don't wait for your "ship to come in " and feel angry and cheated when it doesn't. Get going with something small.
author: Irene Kassorla

quote: Don't sit down and wait for the opportunities to come  you have to get up and make them.
author: Madame C. J. Walker

quote: The individual activity of one man with backbone will do more than a thousand men with a mere wishbone.
author: William J. H. Boetcker

quote: With mere good intentions hell is proverbially paved.
author: William James

quote: All the beautiful sentiments in the world weigh less than a single lovely action.
author: James Russell Lowell

quote: It is vain to say human beings ought to be satisfied with tranquility: they must have action  and they will have it if they cannot find it.
author: George Eliot

quote: Now  go take on the day!
author: Dr. Laura Schlessinger

quote: You can't steal second base and keep one foot on first.
author: Frederick B. Wilson

quote: You cannot dream yourself into a character  you must hammer and forge one for yourself.
author: James A. Froude

quote: What the Puritans gave the world was not thought  but action.
author: Wendell Phillips

quote: Stagnation is something worse than death. It is corruption  also.
author: William Gilmore Simms

quote: I myself must mix with action  lest I wither by despair.
author: Alfred, Lord Tennyson

quote: Psychology is action  not thinking about oneself.
author: Albert Camus

quote: The great end of life is not knowledge  but action.
author: Thomas Henry Huxley

quote: The biggest sin is sitting on your ass.
author: Florynce Kennedy

quote: This is a world of action  and not for moping and droning in.
author: Charles Dickens

quote: Honors and rewards fall to those who show their good qualities in action.
author: Aristotle

quote: Share the passion and action of your time  at peril of being judged not to have lived.
author: Oliver Wendell Holmes Jr.

quote: Action is eloquence.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: The shortest answer is doing.
author: English proverb

quote: The end of man is action.
author: Thomas Carlyle

quote: Optimism  unaccompanied by personal effort  is merely a state of mind  and not fruitful.
author: Edward L. Curtis

quote: To attain happiness in another world we need only to believe something  while to secure it in this world  we must do something.
author: Charlotte P. Gilman

quote: The only menace is inertia.
author: Saint John Perse

quote: One of the reasons why so few of us ever act  instead of react  is because we are continually stifling our deepest impulses.
author: Henry Miller

quote: If a man wants his dreams to come true  he must wake them up.
author: Anonymous

quote: Men expect too much  do too little.
author: Allen Tate

quote: Action may not always bring happiness  but there is no happiness without action.
author: William James

quote: Things don't turn up in this world until somebody turns them up.
author: James A. Garfield

quote: Act-act in the living present!
author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

quote: Life is essentially a series of events to be lived through rather than intellectual riddles to be played with and solved.
author: George A. Buttrick

quote: There are risks and costs to a program of action. But they are far less than the long-range risks and costs of comfortable inaction.
author: John F. Kennedy

quote: What you don't do can be a destructive force.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

quote: He that is overcautious will accomplish little.
author: J. C. F. von Schiller

quote: Untilled ground  however rich  will bring forth thistles and thorns  so also the mind of man.
author: Therese of Lisieux

quote: Often greater risk is involved in postponement than in making a wrong decision.
author: Harry A. Hopf

quote: The bitterest tears shed over graves are for words left unsaid and deeds left undone.
author: Harriet Beecher Stowe

quote: And all that you are sorry for is what you haven't done.
author: Margaret Widdemer

quote: Can anything be sadder than work unfinished? Yes  work never begun.
author: Christina Rossetti

quote: The only things you regret are the things you didn't do.
author: Michael Curtiz

quote: Above all  try something.
author: Franklin Delano Roosevelt

quote: To avoid an occasion for our virtues is a worse degree of failure than to push forward pluckily and make a fall.
author: Robert Louis Stevenson

quote: Indifference and inaction must always pay a penalty.
author: William Feather

quote: Shun idleness. It is a rust that attaches itself to the most brilliant metals.
author: Voltaire

quote: I do not believe in a fate that falls on men however they act  but I do believe in a fate that falls on men unless they act.
author: G. K. Chesterton

quote: The real nature of an ethic is that it does not become an ethic unless and until it goes into action.
author: Margaret Halsey

quote: For it isn't enough to talk about peace. One must believe in it. And it isn't enough to believe in it. One must work at it.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

quote: Words are mere bubbles of water  but deeds are drops of gold.
author: Chinese proverb

quote: Ef women want any rights more'n dey got  why don't dey jes' take 'em and not be talkin' about it.
author: Sojourner Truth

quote: All talk of women's rights is moonshine. Women have every right. They have only to exercise them.
author: Victoria Claffin Woodhull

quote: A man of words and not of deeds is like a garden full of weeds.
author: Anonymous

quote: Life is worth being lived  but not worth being discussed all the time.
author: Isabelle Adfani

quote: Action  not words  are the true criterion of the attachment of friends.
author: George Washington

quote: Words without actions are the assassins of idealism.
author: Herbert Hoover

quote: If you have something to do that is worthwhile doing  don't talk about it ... do it.
author: George W. Biount

quote: If deeds are wanting  all words appear mere vanity and emptiness.
author: Greek proverb

quote: Talking is easy  action difficult.
author: Spanish proverb

quote: One's feelings waste themselves in words  they ought all to be distilled into action ... which bring results.
author: Florence Nightingale

quote: Boast not of what thou would'st have done  but do.
author: John Milton

quote: I like to deliver more than I promise instead of the other way around.
author: Dorothy Uhnak

quote: When I talked  no one listened to me. But as soon as I acted I became persuasive  and I no longer find anyone incredulous.
author: Giosue Borsi

quote: If you can talk brilliantly about a problem  it can create the consoling illusion that it has been mastered.
author: Stanley Kubrick

quote: Words gain credibility by deed.
author: Terence

quote: Men are alike in their promises. It is only in their deeds that they differ.
author: Moliere

quote: An acre of performance is worth a whole world of promise.
author: W. D. Howells

quote: Well done is better than well said.
author: Benjamin Franklin

quote: Our chief defect is that we are more given to talking about things than to doing them.
author: Jawaharlal Nehru

quote: We have too many sounding words and too few actions that correspond with them.
author: Abigail Adams

quote: Activity in back of a very small idea will produce more than inactivity and the planning of a genius.
author: James A. Worsham

quote: When it comes to getting things done  we need fewer architects and more bricklayers.
author: Colleen C. Barrett

quote: Get good counsel before you begin  and when you have decided  act promptly.
author: Sallust

quote: Ideas are one thing  and what happens is another.
author: John Cage

quote: Thinking about swimming isn't much like actually getting in the water. Actually getting in the water can take your breath away.
author: Barbara Sher

quote: All worthwhile men have good thoughts  good ideas and good intentions  but precious few of them ever translate those into action.
author: John Hancock Field

quote: A thought which does not result in an action is nothing much  and an action which does not proceed from a thought is nothing at all.
author: Georges Bernanos

quote: To think is easy. To act is difficult. To act as one thinks is the most difficult of all.
author: Johann von Goethe

quote: Unless a capacity for thinking be accompanied by a capacity for action  a superior mind exists in torture.
author: Benedetto Croce

quote: Contemplation often makes life miserable. We should act more  think less  and stop watching ourselves live.
author: Nicolas de Chamfort

quote: What you theoretically know  vividly realize.
author: Francis Thompson

quote: We must not waste life in devising means. It is better to plan less and do more.
author: William Ellery Channing

quote: The best way to prepare for life is to begin to live.
author: Elbert Hubbard

quote: We are always getting ready to live  but never living.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: Action will remove the doubt that theory cannot solve.
author: Tehyi Hsieh

quote: It is a common observation that those who dwell continually upon their expectations are apt to become oblivious to the requirements of their actual situation.
author: Charles Sanders Peirce

quote: He who deliberates fully before taking a step will spend his entire life on one leg.
author: Chinese proverb

quote: We don't have enough time to premeditate all our actions.
author: Vauvenargues

quote: The opportunity is often lost by deliberating.
author: Publilius Syrus

quote: To think too long about doing a thing often becomes its undoing.
author: Eva Young

quote: Do not wait for ideal circumstances  nor the best opportunities  they will never come.
author: Janet Erskine Stuart

quote: Do what you can  with what you have  where you are.
author: Theodore Roosevelt

quote: Anything worth doing is worth doing too soon.
author: Barbara Sher

quote: "Now" is the operative word. Everything you put in your way is just a method of putting off the hour when you could actually be doing your dream.
author: Barbara Sher

quote: Common sense does not ask an impossible chessboard  but takes the one before it and plays the game.
author: Wendell Phillips

quote: I don't wait for moods. You accomplish nothing if you do that. Your mind must know it has got to get down to earth.
author: Pearl S. Buck

quote: My evil genius Procrastination has whispered me to tarry 'til a more convenient season.
author: Mary Todd Lincoln

quote: I realize that if I wait until I am no longer afraid to act  write  speak  be  I'll be sending messages on a ouija board  cryptic complaints from the other side.
author: Audre Lorde

quote: He who postpones the hour of living is like the rustic who waits for the river to run out before he crosses.
author: Horace

quote: Being unready and ill-equipped is what you have to expect in life. It is the universal predicament. It is your lot as a human being to lack what it takes. Circumstances are seldom right. You never have the capacities  the strength  the wisdom  the virtue you ought to have. You must always do with less than you need in a situation vastly different from what you would have chosen.
author: Charlton Ogburn

quote: He who hesitates is last.
author: Mae West

quote: Conditions are never just right. People who delay action until all factors are favorable do nothing.
author: William Feather

quote: You decide you'll wait for your pitch. Then as the ball starts toward the plate  you think about your stance. And then you think about your swing. And then you realize that the ball that went past you for a strike was your pitch.
author: Bobby Murcer

quote: So what do we do? Anything. Something. So long as we just don't sit there. If we screw it up  start over. Try something else. If we wait until we've satisfied all the uncertainties  it may be too late.
author: Lee Iacocca

quote: Nothing at all will be attempted if all possible objections must first be overcome.
author: Samuel Johnson

quote: No age or time of life  no position or circumstance  has a monopoly on success. Any age is the right age to start doing!
author: Anonymous

quote: Everyone must row with the oars he has.
author: English proverb

quote: The question for each man is not what he would do if he had the means  time  influence and educational advantages  but what he will do with the things he has.
author: Frank Hamilton

quote: How many opportunities come along? If you wait for the right one  that's wrong  because it may never be right  and what have you got to lose? Even if it's a disaster  you've tried  you've learned something  you've had an adventure. And that doesn't mean you can't do it again.
author: Edward McCabe

quote: And now  Lord  what wait I for?
author: Bible

quote: We should be taught not to wait for inspiration to start a thing. Action always generates inspiration. Inspiration seldom generates action.
author: Frank Tibolt

quote: If you wait for inspiration you'll be standing on the corner after the parade is a mile down the street.
author: Ben Nicholas

quote: The best place to succeed is where you are with what you have.
author: Charles M. Schwab

quote: One of these days is none of these days.
author: H. G. Bohn

quote: Who waits until the wind shall silent keep Will never find the ready hour to sow.
author: Helen Hunt Jackson

quote: Begin somewhere  you cannot build a reputation on what you intend to do.
author: Liz Smith

quote: If you wait for the perfect moment when all is safe and assured  it may never arrive. Mountains will not be climbed  races won  or lasting happiness achieved.
author: Maurice Chevalier

quote: There is nothing to be gained by waiting for a better situation. You see where you are and you do what you can with that.
author: Jacob K. Javits

quote: It is in your act that you exist  not in your body. Your act is yourself  and there is no other you.
author: Antoine de Saint-Exupery

quote: The things people discard tell more about them than the things they keep.
author: Hilda Lawrence

quote: The test of any man lies in action.
author: Pindar

quote: Every action we take  everything we do  is either a victory or defeat in the struggle to become what we want to be.
author: Anne Bronte

quote: It's where we go  and what we do when we get there  that tells us who we are.
author: Joyce Carol Oates

quote: By his deeds we know a man.
author: African proverb

quote: A human being has no discernible character until he acts.
author: Constantine Nash

quote: What we make is more important than what we are  particularly if making is our profession.
author: Dorothy L. Sayers

quote: To do is to be.
author: Socrates

quote: You can't build a reputation on what you intend to do.
author: Liz Smith

quote: To be is to do.
author: Plato

quote: The way to do is to be.
author: Lao-Tzu

quote: The ordinary man is involved in action  the hero acts. An immense difference.
author: Henry Miller

quote: We judge ourselves by what we feel capable of doing  while others judge us by what we have already done.
author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

quote: Our deeds determine us  as much as we determine our deeds.
author: George Eliot

quote: The emotions are not always subject to reason ... but they are always subject to action. When thoughts do not neutralize an undesirable emotion  action will.
author: William James

quote: Silences have a climax  when you have got to speak.
author: Elizabeth Bowen

quote: He who desires but acts not breeds pestilence.
author: William Blake

quote: When I am idle and shiftless  my affairs become confused  when I work  I get results ... not great results  but enough to encourage me.
author: Edgar Watson Howe

quote: To be busy with material affairs is the best preservative against reflection  fears  doubts ... all these things which stand in the way of achievement. I suppose a fellow proposing to cut his throat would experience a sort of relief while occupied in stropping his razor carefully.
author: Joseph Conrad

quote: Acting can work a peculiar magic on the actor ... it can cure you (at least for the length of a performance) of a whole variety of ailments. Migraine headaches  miserable colds or toothaches will suddenly disappear as you're up there going through your paces.
author: Barbara Harris

quote: It is only when I dally with what I am about  look back and aside instead of keeping my eyes straight forward  that I feel these cold sinkings of the heart. But the first broadside puts all to rights.
author: Sir Walter Scott

quote: Action is the antidote to despair.
author: Joan Baez

quote: Action is the only reality  not only reality  but morality as well.
author: Abbie Hoffman

quote: Performance releases pressure.
author: Anonymous

quote: Wishing does not make a poor man rich.
author: Arab proverb

quote: You can't get rich sitting on the bench.
author: Phil Linz

quote: Action makes more fortunes than caution.
author: Vauvenargues

quote: For purposes of action  nothing is more useful than narrowness of thought combined with energy of will.
author: Henri Frederic Amiel

quote: How  then  find the courage for action?... By accepting the human condition more simply and candidly  by dreading troubles less  calculating less  hoping more.
author: Henri Frederic Amiel

quote: Necessity of action takes away the fear of the act.
author: Francis Quarles

quote: Commitment leads to action. Action brings your dream closer.
author: Marcia Wieder

quote: One starts an action simply because one must do something.
author: T. S. Eliot

quote: We couldn't possibly know where it would lead  but we knew it had to be done.
author: Betty Friedan

quote: It is more blessed to give than to receive.
author: Anonymous

quote: You give but little when you give of your possessions. It is when you give of yourself that you truly give.
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: I make presents to the mother  but think of the daughter.
author: Goethe

quote: Give an inch  he'll take an ell.
author: Thomas Hobbes

quote: He gives twice who gives quickly.
author: Publius Mimus

quote: Or what man is there of you  whom if his son ask bread  will he give him a stone?
author: Matthew

quote: Rich gifts wax poor when givers prove unkind.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: I fear the Greeks  even when they bring gifts.
author: Virgil

quote: Behold  I do not give lectures or a little charity  When I give I give myself.
author: Walt Whitman

quote: There is one glory of the sun  and another glory of the moon  and another glory of the stars: for one star differeth from another star in glory.
author: Anonymous

quote: The paths of glory lead but to the grave.
author: Thomas Gray

quote: Mine eyes have seen the coming of the glory of the Lord.
author: Julia Ward Howe

quote: O how quickly passes away the glory of the earth.
author: Thomas a Kempis

quote: One crowded hour of glorious life Is worth an age without a name.
author: Walter Scott

quote: God helps those who help themselves.
author: Anonymous

quote: Man proposes  and God disposes.
author: Ariosto

quote: God's in His Heaven -  All's right with the world!
author: Elizabeth Barrett Browning

quote: Fear that man who fears not God.
author: Abd-el-Kader

quote: Nearer  my God  to Thee - Nearer to Thee -  E'en though it be a cross That raiseth me  Still all my song shall be Nearer  my God  to Thee  Nearer to Thee!
author: Sarah Flower Adams

quote: I took a day to search for God  And found Him not. But as I trod By rocky ledge  through woods untamed  Just where one scarlet lily flamed  I saw His foot print in the sod.
author: Bliss Carman

quote: A picket frozen on duty  -  A mother starved for her brood -  Socrates drinking the hemlock  And Jesus on the rood  And millions who  humble and nameless  The straight  hard pathway trod  -  Some call it Consecration  And others call it God.
author: W. H. Carruth

quote: God hath chosen the foolish things of the world to confound the wise  and God hath chosen the weak things of the world to confound the things that are mighty.
author: Anonymous

quote: God moves in a mysterious way His wonders to perform  He plants his footsteps in the sea And rides upon the storm.
author: William Cowper

quote: God is incorporeal  divine  supreme  infinite Mind  Spirit  Soul  Principle  life  Truth  Love.
author: Mary Baker Eddy

quote: An honest God is the noblest work of man.
author: Charles J. Ingersoll

quote: "We trust  Sir  that God is on our side." "It is more important to know that we are on God's side."
author: Abraham Lincoln

quote: A mighty fortress is our God  A bulwark never failing  Our helper he amid the flood Of mortal ills prevailing.
author: Martin Luther

quote: Everyone is in a small way the image of God.
author: Marcus Manilius

quote: What is it: is man only a blunder of God  or God only a blunder of man?
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: A God-intoxicated man.
author: Novalis

quote: He mounts the storm  and walks upon the wind.
author: Alexander Pope

quote: The heavens declare the glory of God  and the firmament showeth his handiwork.
author: Bible

quote: He maketh me to lie down in green pastures  he leadeth me beside the still warm waters.
author: Bible

quote: God is our refuge and strength  a very present help in trouble.
author: Bible

quote: There is no respect of persons with God.
author: Romans

quote: If God be for us  who can be against us?
author: Romans

quote: The divine essence itself is love and wisdom.
author: Emmanuel Swedenborg

quote: God  the Great Giver  can open the whole universe to our gaze in the narrow space of a single lane.
author: Rabindranath Tagore

quote: Rock of Ages  cleft for me  Let me hide myself in thee.
author: Augustus Toplady

quote: God tempers the wind to the shorn lamb.
author: Laurence Sterne

quote: If there were no God  it would be necessary to invent him.
author: Voltaire

quote: Give way to the Better if way to the Better there be  It exacts a full look at the Worst.
author: Thomas Hardy

quote: The significance of a man is not in what he attains but rather in what he longs to attain.
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: Once you say you're going to settle for second  that's what happens to you in life  I find.
author: John F. Kennedy

quote: A successful individual typically sets his next goal somewhat but not too much above his last achievement. In this way he steadily raises his level of aspiration.
author: Kurt Lewin

quote: The most absurd and reckless aspirations have sometimes led to extraordinary success.
author: Vauvenargues

quote: All rising to great places is by a winding stair.
author: Francis Bacon

quote: The only thing to know is how to use your neuroses.
author: Arthur Adamov

quote: Every ceiling  when reached  becomes a floor  upon which one walks as a matter of course and prescriptive right.
author: Aldous Huxley

quote: We can always redeem the man who aspires and strives.
author: Goethe

quote: The world stands aside to let anyone pass who knows where he is going.
author: David Starr Jordan

quote: I have learned to have very modest goals for society and myself  things like clean air  green grass  children with bright eyes  not being pushed around  useful work that suits one's abilities  plain tasty food  and occasional satisfying nookie.
author: Paul Goodman

quote: If you would hit the mark  you must aim a little above it: Every arrow that flies feels the attraction of earth.
author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

quote: Ah  but a man's reach should exceed his grasp  or what's a heaven for?
author: Robert Browning

quote: Before we set our hearts too much upon anything  let us examine how happy they are  who already possess it.
author: La Rochefoucauld

quote: Ours is a world where people don't know what they want and are willing to go through hell to get it.
author: Don Marquis

quote: Accept the place the divine providence has found for you  the society of your contemporaries  the connection of events.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: Those who aim at great deeds must also suffer greatly.
author: Plutarch

quote: It is a mistake to look too far ahead. Only one link in the chain of destiny can be handled at a time.
author: Winston Churchill

quote: Do not wish to be anything but what you are  and try to be that perfectly.
